title: Unprofessional Higher Management
text:
When I booked Hotel Batra, I assumed that the hotel will have some standards and I will have a comfortable stay.  When I checked-in, I was amazed to see how Ms.Asima handled the conversation and I immediately felt comfortable with the two lovely ladies at the Front Office.  My stay was comfortable with the cordial staff, more so my everyday interaction with the ladies at the FO.  To further clarify, me as a single woman staying at the hotel, I had many inhibitions; but, Ms.Asima and Ms.Bismah really made me feel relaxed.  They treated me more than a guest.  However,  today, i.e. on 7th December my check-out was a nightmare.  It completely overshadowed my lovely stay and I left with a horrible impression of Hotel Batra.  While checking out, by mistake the FO charged the extra 5k of advance that I had paid earlier.  Mistakes happen and we all are humans.  Infact to err ìs human.  I wasn't that worried coz I knew that there are official procedures to handle this, for instance a 'paid out voucher' is all they needed.  Which the management lied to me saying that they don't have the authority on anything.  FYI, I belong to the hotel industry and we know all the processes.   The management thought I was a foolish guest.  To make things worse, I immediately heard a loud bang on the wall of the Front Office.  I was taken aback and when Ms. Bismah turned around to go to  the next door, I realized somebody called out.  Ohmygod! Which manager calls out an employee, with a loud bang on the wall??? I was a guest standing, any many others were walking in to take the lift.  Then I hear Ms.Asima being called in.  And at the top of his voice, some bloody manager yelled at the girls asking them to leave the work and go.  I and other guests could hear the whole conversation in the lobby.  Then I see the girls coming out in tears.  All this for bloody 5k??? My questions to the General Manager of the hotel are:
-If these girls have done a mistake, what did the Operations Manager do??? He has completely spoiled the reputation of your hotel.
-If women are treated like this in a workplace, what hospitality can you provide the guests, especially women? Which means I can also be ill treated any time.
-How dare the OM shout at the girls, but did not have the guts to come and talk to me? 
-Is this how your lower staff is treated in the hotel? Then, why is he an OM?  He doesn't deserve that position.
I wanted to get inside and give him a piece of my mind, but the girls at the FO requested me not to.  Ms.Asima could not even face me and talk.  If this isn't a terrible thing, then what is?
My last impression of my stay is unbelievably horrible.  I was supposed to come back this month end to stay again.  But I shall not, and I shall also ask my friends and family never to stay at Hotel Batra again.  With a hope that action will be taken against the OM, if not hospitality is just a word which is unpracticed.  This unprofessional behavior should not be let gone.
placeInfo/address: Pure Vegetarian Hotel Durganag, Dalgate, Dallake, Srinagar 190001 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Excellent stay in HOTEL BATRA - SRINAGAR.
text:
We had booked 2 rooms.

1. Very good and well maintained rooms.

2. Excellent food for vegetarians. Since, we do not consume onions, garli, raddish, etc the restaurant (NIRAMISH) ensured we are appropriately taken care of during our entire stay of 7 nights. The variety offered was also appreciable. Special thanks to Sajjad, Tanveer and team for taking good care of us.

3. We had booked the hotel car for the entire stay of 6 days. The driver gentleman, Mr.Aijaz was very pleasant to interact with and guided us very well. He was PATIENCE PERSONIFIED.

Swaminathan (from Chennai)

title: LOWEST GRADE SERVICE POSSIBLE
text:
We went for a snack. 
Floor Manager behaved like, why the hell are you here?
A staff said,  Please sit,  We will serve. 
We ordered Tea, Pakara & Grilled sandwich. 
What we received was COLD TEA, 6 COLD PIECES OF BREAD WITH ONLY CHEESE IN IT, NO VEGETABLES, DRESSING OR ANYTHING ELSE.
When we were about to get up after consuming cold bread with cold TEA the guy brought Pakara which were also drenched in oil.When we went for the bill at the counter the floor manager said that The TEA was complementary  like it justifies the pathetic quality of service.

STAY AWAY!!!!!!

title: Welcome.hotel for a convenient stay in Dal Lake
text:
I wanted  to share a wonderful experience I recently had during my stay at the Welcome Hotel in Srinagar. The hotel is conveniently located on the serene Dal Lake, making it easily accessible to all the ghats, which is a huge plus for those looking to explore the area.

The staff at the Welcome Hotel were incredibly helpful and polite, ensuring that all our needs were met with a smile. Their warm hospitality truly made our stay a memorable one. Additionally, the food at the hotel was delicious, offering a variety of flavorful dishes that catered to all our tastes.The menu is expensive.  The F & B staff were so courteous . 

I highly recommend considering the Welcome Hotel Srinagar for your future visits to the region. It was a delightful experience, and I am sure you will enjoy it as much as I did.

Special thanks to Masoor imtiazcand syed for the incredible support and have no words to express their support during the emergency especially for tourists. They made us feel at home. 

Highly appreciate the entire team of Welcome hotel, dal lake.

title: Relationships beyond Business
text:
Dear Top Management of Welcome Hotel Group,

Warm Greetings,

I am delighted to address this mail to you. Me and my family stayed in your hotel at Srinagar between 14 to 16 April 2025 (3 Nights) . It was not only a comfortable stay but very happy and lively too.

Right from the start at the front desk, service staff, bell boys everyone was smiling, welcoming and eager to help. Both my daughters took liking towards Mr Masroor Ali, who in turned was very warm and a good story teller (a must quality for a Hotelier)

The breakfast and dinner spread was good and adequate. The service staff did not mind running back and forth for Chappaties / Sabjji's.

However the highlight of our experience was on  19 April 2025. Thanks to SpiceJet they cancelled the flight at the very last moment. My daughters were alone at the Airport from 3 pm in the afternoon to almost midnight. 

Our local support Mr Jimmy was a saviour, he not only carried something to eat but dropped them to the Welcome hotel. Mr Nikhil (Traveniti, Hubali, Karnatak. Our booking company) was the key to coordinate  and supervise the movement of my daughters right from the time the airlines started delaying the flight until they reached the hotel, as well as the following day until they reached Bangalore their destination.

The hotel  staff was kind enough to find a room for them to stay, in spite of the hotel running full. Once they reached the Hotel we as parents were so relieved. Both my daughters were pleased, and found home at your property. The next day they were dropped off at the airport post breakfast. We were told the hotel was going to hold rooms until they take off and reach Delhi. That was so thoughtful of them.

I, along with my family, will always be grateful to everyone at your hotel.  This will be a lifetime of memories.

Thank you everyone, once again

I strongly recommend that you recognise this effort by your staff. May you always get the best resources and your enterprise prosper and achieve many milestones.   

Best Regards,

Hemal Desai
COO
Mayur Group,
Dharwad, Karnataka.
+9611165554
(Mayur Aaditya Resort, now Menaka Inn)
(USF Foods & Allied Products Pvt Ltd.,)

title: One of the best hotels near Dal Lake
text:
A very good hotel just in the opposite side of Dal Lake. The rooms are very neat and tidy. Especially the business suite and the suite rooms. Most of the amenities as daily per requirement are available. Availability of car parking is a great advantage.

We had few problems related to bathroom blockage but hats off to the entire staff who spontaneously fixed the problems in no time.

The only advice to the management is to regularly check the bathroom blockage and room electrical switches as few of them were not in working condition in our Business Suite Room. Also the bathrooms should have exhaust fans installed.

The entire hotel staff deserve a 5 star rating for their spontaneous and humble behavior. Great service.

One advice....please increase your FOOD MENU.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest: 

Greetings from Welcome Hotel Srinagar Dal Lake.

We look forward to welcoming you back soon and ensuring an even better experience next time

Warm regards,
Masroor Ali

Overall it was a very good experience and would highly recommend.

title: Good location! Slow service!
text:
Very good location with (veg)restaurants and shops close by but the staff behaves like they are  either too lazy or they don't care about the customers.
Pros:
- Located centrally, walkable to  Dal gate and 5 min ride to lal chowk market.
- Heater/AC in the room works well - hot water only available at certain hours in the morning n evening but was not an issue
- room was big and spacious 
- Decent spread and variety in the bf and dinner buffet . 
- 
Cons:
 - the staff was very slow at everything we asked. We had to ask twice for towels , twice for hot water in the bathroom, many times to get a cab arranged for sightseeing. They do provide the service but we had to reach out multiple times
- housekeeping does not replace toiletries or the bedsheets. We had to ask on the second day for these else they would just clean the floor and set the bed. They don't provide basic things like a door mat outside the bathroom and they gave us wet towels when we asked on one day
- if the room is road facing there is traffic noise from the road.

I noticed strangely no one offered to help with the baggage during checkout. That was not a problem but in Kashmir generally people like hotel staff and watchmen are behind you for tips but that did not happen here.
ownerResponse/text:

title: Unfortunate booking @ Jamal Resorts
text:
First of all, thank God for saving us from staying at this place! We had booked this resort through MakeMyTrip, totally falling for the handsome, spic & span pictures that the resort have posted everywhere and trusting that stuff eventually! I had specifically written to them in an email what exactly I was looking for, why this trip was important for us but all that seemed to have had no affect whatsoever when we finally arrived here all the way from Pahalgam. We had our ageing father with us for whom this whole trip was planned and when we were shown into our room, we were in for a rude shock. I am not saying that its not a nice property. The property itself is good enough but it would seem that someone somewhere in the management is no longer paying enough attention to little details. Room was small, smelly and nothing like what they have shown on their online pictures. Room was not very clean, had a faint overpowering damp smell and strictly not worth my hard earned money. 
If it hadn't been for the kind service of MakeMyTrip who were kind enough to refund my money one hundred percent, I would have been at a total loss. So we cancelled our booking there and then and left.

title: totally unprofessional and rude attitude
text: very much rude and unprofessional attitude. As per hotel staff their policy states to have food at common place by buffet service. When question was raised why such rules are followed at times of COVID they argued that they will follow their policy and social distancing would be maintained Also the staff was so arrogant that he proposed if meal was served at room we would be charged for food and services , which was already being paid beforehand.And real time no covid protocol was followed. We have to check out after 1 night where we had booking for 2 nights. There are lots of other hotels at Srinagar,please don't go and spoil your holiday. Plus they keep on calling to delete the review in return they will provide free staying and touring from their behalf
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Good property but poor maintenance
text:
The property is good, however the maintenance is pretty bad. We have booked super deluxe room so that we will have better features when compared to deluxe room ( only difference is tub with extra sofa in room for both). However, tub itself is non functional and bathroom window is half open which did not seem safe. When requested to get it closed, they just brushed it off.
Also their WiFi was almost always non functional. And they did not even try to fix the issue on complaint. Regardless of how good the property one would be, if the service and hospitality isn't good, it's of no use.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Beautiful property & tasty food by Showkat bhai
text: We stayed in hotel Jamal Resort for 02 nights, the property is very beautiful with a big garden & cozy room, the staff is very nice but have to remember them once we ask for anything, the reception guy is very helpful... well we were booked with breakfast & Dinner, I personally thank Mr. Showkat (chef) for making our trip tasty & memorable...
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Average
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights from 3rd to 5th April.
Hotel was full to capacity hence the staff was stretched in providing services 
HK staff would come only if called.Bottle of water which should be there regularly was delivered only when asked 
No one came to collect room service plates for 24 hours 
Rooms are decent 
Stayed in Room 204 WiFi connection was not working as it is last room 
As the Room is above the kitchen there was lots of noise till late in night due to cleaning work going on.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Nice stay
text: My friends and I had transit stay at Jamal as we were waiting for our next flights since they were cancelled due to weather. The location of this property is brilliant. Close to Dal lake. Courteous staff. Cute property. So while we waited we explored Srinagar due to its close proximity to downtown. All in all we had a very comfortable stay.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Nice stay
text: The resort is not far from boulevard road. The rooms are nice. We booked an interconnecting room. The interiors are good. The rooms were spacious. The bathrooms were clean as well. The staff is very courteous and welcoming. Overall the experience was good and I would certainly recommend this place.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Excellent Property with Luxury!
text: Jamal Resorts is a lovely property. Stayed 01 Night only. Good rooms with all amenities, including luxury, good furniture, very clean beds & bathrooms, great service, nice people. Staff is Helpful Especially Mr.Lateef ,he helped me a lot I forgot my license at pahalgam he helped me to bring my license  He also Upgraded my Room From Deluxe to super Deluxe without any charge  HouseKeeping Staff also Friendly Especially Mr.Majeed and Tariq .Air Condition  arrangements are average to good. The location is average in terms of view, however, if you are looking for peace without hustle bustle and away from the city, then this property is ideal. Peaceful, Beautiful & Comfortable! Good for families as well, plenty of open space for the kids to play. Also nice place for couples if they are looking for peace & solitude. Crack a good deal before you book!
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Nice property. Spacious rooms with good interiors.
text:
Our trip to Kashmir concluded with last two nights at Jamal Resorts.
It is a nice, spacious hotel located between Shalimar & Nishat Garden. Bit away from Dal Lake.
Room 126 is most spacious with antique feel, with Wooden interiors and exquisite paintings.
They also have outdoor lawn sitting area and special place for a candle light dinner.
Room service needs improvement. Bathroom design is average. Toiletries are just average local soap and shampoo sachets. Buffet breakfast was average. A la Carte menu is bit pricey.

On last day we were late due to heavy traffic at Sonmarg. However Latif ensured that the dinner is prepared and served when we arrived.

Overall a pleasant stay.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Good hospitality and service
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel and rooms are good. Food is tasty. Good room with room heater facility. Never felt cold inside the room being very cold outside the room. 
Staff are friendly and helpful. They are always available to assist.  1 night we reached late after sightseeing. Staff called us to ask for dinner which is a great example of good service.
Would have given 5 star if it was near Dal Lake. It is away from Dal lake and Srinagar city. Almost 30 minutes by car.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Friendly staff, Good Rooms and prompt Service
text: My Room was just opposite the main entrance.  Good Room with amenities functioning properly.  Neat and Tidy, worth living in Jamal Resort.  All staff are very hospitable and prompt to respond to your requirements.  Worth living in Jamal Resort and will visit soon next season.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India

title: A valuable trip
text: I booked through travel Guru after searching hotels at Srinagar.I choose Jamal Resorts at Srinagar .After reaching Hotel I have been very well welcomed.I met the manager Mr Seroz at reception.He helped me a lot regarding my sightsceen.I Visited accordingly it was really enjoyable and amazing.He also Provided me a Cab.The driver was very polite and well mannered ,He never refused any thing.My last year trip was  spoiled by the hotel Grandmahal.The staff were very rude and i went for a complaint against food the manager told me that you  have consumed 40% food how can I accept food is not good.I felt  very much upset.Atleast he must have to tell me I will Check it.Any way this year I choosed Jamal Resorts.it is totally different.The staff is very well trained ,very good service. I really found it valuable .I suggest to all Indian people book JamalResorts in Srinagar.Thanku so much Jamal u are really kamal.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Family may be.. Not for solo...
text:
I booked this hotel as it says 1km from dal lake and it's walking distance. However it's on the other side of the lake where no shikara rides or any activities take place. I paid 950/- for prepaid taxi from airport. It is that far. The resort is close to Nishat Garden and is almost outskirts of the active locality. Being a solo traveller the location proved to my disadvantage as I had to take rickshaw to visit TRC and Dal Lake and enede up paying a good chunk of money. Also the sharing cab people won't pick you up from this place.
The manager scared me off the very first minute I check in by saying there are no sharing rides from Srinagar to Leh. Anyways other staff seemed helpful.
Room was clean and good. Best part of the stay was the bed though. Very relaxing.
Can't comment much on food as I had only sandwich and tea which were average.
Overall an average stay. Would recommend staying on boulevard street if you're travelling solo.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Amazing property
text: I had a comfortable stay with my family. The staff was helpfull. It's close to the dal lake walking distance. There is a guitar gang and shiv templecright outside the hotel which many people would not even know about and is not listed on the tourist places to see. So that was a highlight. There is a good market where we could shop for kesar and walnuts. I got the walnuts at 700 kg. The white looking walnuts are fresh. Kesar for 200. And almonds for 750 kg. Kewah for 200 rs thought it would help for those who are interested nothing more than that. Do not take autos take sharing three wheelers who take you to dal gate for 20rs. And over all we had a great stay. Srinagar had many myths such as it's not safe. I could jog around the whole city. Like in many sense it was like any other city. Though they show srinagar band stories on TV which is not true. As it was normal. But we need to be aware at all times.over all decent stay.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Enjoyable Stay
text:
We stayed with our family (5 + 1) for 4 days (01 Oct - 04 Oct-23) and it was definitely a pleasant one.

Staff at the reception (Muzafar, Moonesa & Tahir), 

Room Service (Nadeem, Irshad and one more) and 

Restaurant (Sajjad & Imran) were all very courteous and supportive.

They all made sure that our stay was quite enjoyable with their pleasing manners and service.

Big plus for choosing this one is, it's 100 % Vegetarian. Restaurant served a variety of delicious dishes, both for Breakfast and Dinner.

Batra Hotels, Srinagar is definitely value for money in our view.

Would strongly recommend to all families going on a vacation to Srinagar.

title: Memorable experience..Thanks to the wonderful staff
text:
I had a wonderful stay at this hotel! The property itself is clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, but what really made the experience special was the staff. From check-in to check-out, every team member I interacted with was warm, professional, and genuinely helpful.

The front desk staff greeted me with a smile and made the process smooth and quick. Housekeeping kept the room spotless every day, and the restaurant staff went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and well taken care of.

Their attentiveness, kindness, and willingness to help with even the smallest requests truly stood out. It’s rare to see such a consistent level of hospitality across the whole team, and it made me feel right at home.

Highly recommend this hotel—not just for the facilities, but for the amazing staff who make the stay memorable.

title: Centrally located charming hotel
text:
Radisson in Srinagar is located about 1.4 km from Lal Chowk, Dal Lake and Shikaras in a side street about 50 Mts from main road.
It's clean spacious and well maintained.
Front desk and resturant on ground floor. Total 5 floor building.
Atrium design with glass lift gives good view.
All staff be front desk, resturant and house keeping v helpful.
On reception we by some chance got to develop a special bond with Mr Sabit who being off duty next day accompanied us for sight seeing as we got Radisson vehicle booked for this purpose. He and driver acted as our guides for the day.

Overall it was an happy satisfying stay. Good staff, tasty food and feel good environment.
Thanks all.

title: Royal Kings Stay
text:
The property is Huge with all amenities.First of all it location is near Dal Lake on other side,near to Nishat Garden,Peace full.Big reception ,Maitained Large Garden to play and sit outside.TT table to play .Big rooms with all facilities like Fridge,Gyser,AC,Wooden floooring and roof,also neat & clean.
The food is Buffet type which is for every taste,Veg & non-veg.Decorative lawn outside the rooms to sit in the evening for relaxation.
All the staff are helpful & courteous.The price is also Genuine for room Rs3000/-per night and Buffet Rs200/-and Rs400/-for Breakfast and dinner respectively with discount of 25% to 30%.
Our children enjoyed the place very much.Also ther is Big showroom for Carpet and Kashmiri suits inside the property but bit costly.
Our all it was nice stay for 3 nites. 25-May to 28 May 17.
The Resort is best for Family and Group tour.
I do not think why some of the people reviewed in negative regarding this Resort for may be some personal small things.
Over all it is comfortable and value for money stay.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

Thank you for sparing your valuable time and posting your review of Jamal Resorts, Srinagar on Trip Advisor from your stay with us! Jamal Resorts takes guest feedback very seriously and we use it as the only authentic tool to constantly improve our services.

title: Criminal Hotel
text: We visited this hotel on May 18, 2016 and we checked in late around 9 p.m. and found to our shock that the hotel had sold our room to someone else and that day the hotel was completely sold out. The hotel manager transferred us to thier new wing which was told to us that it is only 5 mins away from the main hotel but in reality it was 30 mins away. When we reached the new wing to our shock we found that it was actually a guest house / servant quarters for thier staff which had no security no restaurant no dinning place no facility at all. I was travellling with an infant baby and hence i refused to stay at such an unsafe place. The hotel manager was highly pathetic man . He refused to give refund as well. AT 10.00 p.m. at night in srinagar we managed to find another hotel and moved out of this hell hotel. We will Never visit this place again . Infact the hotel needs to be sued for such criminal acitivities. Pls dont ever ever ever visit this hotel orelse you will really find yourself in great trouble

title: Avoid, avoid, avoid!
text: Please do not be fooled by the management photos. The resort is badly maintained, overpriced, away from all attractions and without facilities like wifi, food, etc. Our room was not cleaned for the entire length of the stay, the towels were worn out, faded and old. We had to keep calling the housekeeping to fix the tv and geyser. Food was of very low quality. We had to hire a taxi for the full length of the stay to get around Srinagar because of this hotel's location.

title: Worst hospitality
text:
Hey guys,
If your choosing this place for a vacation I am sure your gonna end up standing in the streets of Srinagar or at-least in one roofless shelter in that freezing cold. Kindly take my review seriously as its my Family's experience

I must warn you about Jamal resorts n makemytrip & co
I had been to Srinagar recently with my close knitted family group of 20 which comprised of just two men n d rest were women n children. We had booked jamal resorts thru makemytrip and had the confirmation mail also. 

1- We had booked 3 moths prior to our trip @ normal prices but I guess as d season started earlier they gave our booked rooms for better deals n asked us to go to another place they suggested..

2- when asked about it both makemytrip and Jamal resorts incharges didn't respond properly. They kept blaming each other. 
3 - we payed them but after long arguments n a few hours of standing in the cold my family  had to compromise and stay in a different hotel
4 - worst responses and hospitality. Literally money oriented and Fraudism 
 Comorade Inn only accommodated us later and they were gud in all means :)
Most important on that same day and tym we faced this problem two other families had the same issues and were sent to different places. And one of them had also prebooked through makemytrip.

We choose Jamal resorts based on the tripadvisor review only and faced a lot of issues that's d only reason I decided to write a review. 

So plz plz plz be very very cautious while booking with them earlier and if ur booking tru makemytrip be extra careful. It's a kind n genuine request based on my experience
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Nice stay
text:
Great and comfortable stay.
We stayed in welcome hotel in the  month  of February 2025 .Hotel is in front of Dal lake with a very beautiful view and lot of restaurants and cafe near by. The stay was very good with neat and clean room and with centralised heating system. The staff at welcome hotel were very friendly, courteous and addressed our needs immediately. Food was exceptional as well and dessert in tea room was yummy as well. Hotel staff checked on our safety during heavy snow and helped us in reaching srinagar safe. Overall a very good experience, I would definitely book welcome hotel sgr for my next visit to Srinagar. Special thanks  to Mr  imtiyaz front desk, who helped us with the booking and kept checking on our safety when struck in heavy snow. Highly recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay.

title: Kashmir Trip
text:
The Batra Hotel & Residences , just remember this name for the best hotel in Srinagar. I have stay for a few days at this hotel. Stepping through the lobby, i was immediately struck by the beautiful and friendly reception area. Light, airy and very spacious...very welcoming atmosphere. The staff throughout the hotel were very professional, friendly and extremely helpful. They always greeting and smiling to us. The breakfasts were amazing. The location of the hotel is great. The room was very spacious and well equipped with all essentials and fantastic view. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to the tourists who want to go to Srinagar. Will be back to this place soon..!!!
I specially appreciate Mr Rashid at Front Desk he is always helpful and he always keep smile on his face he always checks the guest either he or she ia comfortable or not I whish Rashid Best of Luck for his future..

title: Be aware...The worst place to book.
text:
Jamal resort is the worst place to book for anybody who visits Kashmir.We had booked an entire package  tour for kashmir through make- mytrip and we did not have a single problem anywhere but in this place.
   With the confirmation vouchers in our hand and the entire money paid they denied us booking and left us to stay outside in the kashmir cold for 2 hours.we were a group of  20 with mostly ladies and small kids.They just denied us 9 rooms point blank. Surprisingly there were an other two families that had the same experience along with us and in total that same  evening there were three booking that were denied.
  Please please be aware of the fraud ants that these people are.Never ever book this place coz you may be left out in the kashmir cold  and you will be forced to shift to some shabby place that they offer coz u are left with no other choice .

title: Huge Property and No Service..
text:
First we were provided a room where there was a stingy foul smell which didnt go even after using different kind of sprays.
Second, I found a huge spider on the wall..I mean really bad. After trying for a long time with those sprays etc, they werent able to take it out and left it there.
Third, The dish connection in our TV didnt work even after being told that they recharged it twice.
Then when i opened the water tap in bathroom, the water started streaming out of geyzer which was applied there with all open wires.
Finally after so many complaints and to the danger of electrocution, they changed our room (upgraded one) showing us like they were doing us a big favour.
Well to our surprise, the "upgraded" room had its own faults too. With half of the Switches not working or the intercom.
Then again, the dish was not working either, even after recharge which they told us that they did. When we told that its not possible to not have dish if you have recharged it. Then to my utter surprise,they tell us that they couldnt do it and also "How does cable matter, you can sleep by 12, till that time, it will work".
I am giving 2 stars only because breakfast was good. Other than that, nothing. Disappointing experience.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Disappointing.
text:
We stayed there for 1 night and were not very pleased with the whole experience. Looks OK from outside and lobby is clean too. The rooms are tiny and very dimly lit. Bathrooms too very dimly lit. The faucets, the fittings almost everything needed repair. The whole furniture in the room needed repair. Drawers had their handles broken, ply sticking out etc. Had to call room service about 3 times only to get them to bring us a electric kettle. 
The food was sub standard. Dinner was way too spicy. Soup had so much chilly, none of us could finish even half a bowl. The remaining items in the buffet were the same. B'fast had very little options, and was served cold. The restaurant furniture too was totally dilapidated. 
Not recommended.

title: Nice Place with Good Food
text: We were near the Nishat Gardens, so we decided to drop in to Jamal Resorts for Lunch. This is a nice resort, well done up & looks good too. The Restaurant is fairly large & well furnished. The Washrooms are also very clean (despite the shabby entrance door) & the Wash Basins have running Hot & Cold Water, which is a blessing to prevent your fingers from Freezing when you wash your hands. The food is good. We tried the Kashmiri Wazwan Waza Chicken with Butter Nan, Tawa Roti & Gulab Jamuns - it was very good. The Waza Chicken & Butter Nan were both very good. The prices are also very reasonable & the service though a bit slow, is good as the waiters are quite polite & helpful. There is also adequate parking available, so that's another plus point. I would recommend a visit whenever in the area.

title: A complete disaster & overpriced
text:
What was supposed to be a relaxing end to a two weeks road trip turned out to be quite the opposite.

Few hours after checking in, and having a relaxing time in room, I received a call from reception advising to vacate the room due to maintenance issues with the AC and warm water.  Of course this was very inconvenient but eventually managed to get all my packing sorted, and out I went.

Once at my new room, which was suppose to be an "upgrade", but turned out to be exactly the same room category but in a much worse condition..I chose to accept it.  Unpacked my luggage for a second time, and eventually managed to settle in a relax mode.  One hour later I was going for a bath and turned on the water and out poured disgusting muddy brown and smelling wanter!  Picked up the phone, dialled reception and asked for the manager to come to inspect.  He did, and once again I found myself packing up and vacating the room.

This time, I had to wait downstairs while another suitable room was getting located...which eventually they found - my original room I initially had checked in too!!  Turned out there was nothing wrong with it to begin with!!!

So few hours later, after tons of inconvenience and frustration, I was back in my original room.

All I got for the hassle, was a free meal at the restaurant, which was nothing compared to what I went through.  The restaurant experience was also not without faults.  There were too many staff on the floor without enough work to do, so they all gathered around the wait station and having a social hang out, which was also right next to my table where I am trying to enjoy my meal in relaxation - but instead I have to listen to their loud conversation and laughters....very professional!!  To top it up, exactly the same thing next morning at breakfast service also!

All of this for a very crazy overpriced hotel!

A complete unacceptable experience.  I have been a Radisson VIP member for years, and this is without doubt the worse I have had to experience!
placeInfo/address: 11 Maulana Azad Road, Srinagar 190001 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

AQIB is very professional, kind and made my experience at the restaurant  memorable. WILL HAVE TO COME BACK AGAIN. title: Spectacular view of Dal Lake from this lakefont hotel
text:
It was my wife's first trip to Kashmir and I wanted us to stay at a place overlooking the Dal Lake. Welcome Hotel turned out to be just perfect.

Ghat no 7 was right across the hotel and every evening it was convenient to walk across to the lake and sit by its side, soaking in its beauty. The view of the lake from our room was nothing short of spectacular and although the lakefront rooms are higher priced I think it was money well spent.

The room was really spacious and well done. The restaurant had a great array of options, the food was yummy and for a change I found a hotel where I didnt have complaints about housekeeping and service in general.

Overall, 26 years after marriage our stay at Welcome will go down for us as one of the most memorable ever. Thank you guys and keep up the good work, Syed, Imtiaz and team.

title: Great Hospitality and Fresh Delicious Vegetarian Food served lovingly
text:
I, and my family of 4 stayed at the Batra Hotel in Srinagar for 5 nights from March 25 onwards. We stayed in Srinagar and went to Gulmarg and other places as day excursions.

We made our bookings well in advance with the General Manager, Mr. Jaydeep Bhat. We met him in person during our stay and it was wonderful talking to him everyday.  He extended a lot of warmth and affection to the entire family.  He guided us well, he was very co-operative,  and offered great hospitality. 

A special mention about Mr. Ashish Sharda, the rooms division manager who smilingly assisted us in all our requirements.  He made sure we have a really comfortable stay at the hotel.  
Room Tip: They have connecting room options for families. We had 2 connecting rooms for us. 

Mr. Bashir Ahmed, along with his team including Wasim and Haroon in the food and beverages section served us everyday with a smile on their face and a lot of love.

A highlight of this hotel is its freshly prepared delicious vegetarian spread.  We enjoyed the food everyday which was served to us with great love. They used to come and serve piping hot rotis on our table. Kahwa was simply amazing. The food at the hotel is absolutely worthy of every praise possible. 
Plan Tip: We had opted for a plan inclusive of breakfast and dinner.  This is a really good option to select. 

We will surely recommend staying at the Batra Hotel and enjoying their hospitality to everyone who is planning a trip to Kashmir.

title: BATRA, The B est Accomodation for TRAvellers
text:
I am from Hyderabad and visited Srinagar previous week with my family and stayed for 4 days at The Batra Hotel Srinagar. Prior to the visit, I interacted with Mr Saqib, Assistant Reservations Manager at the Hotel though Phone, Whatsapp and Email for assistance regarding Accommodation at BATRA hotel. I was extremely happy with the communication with him. He was very soft-spoken, gentle and quite informative. He has given excellent guidance on various tourist places in and around Srinagar and Climate there-in. 

Upon arrival in the hotel, we were given a warm welcome by the staff, with the special Kashmiri Kahwa. The room was very comfortable, spacious with excellent ambiance and a grand view of the Snow mountains through the Window. The breakfast and Dinner at the Pure Vegetarian Niramish Restaurent were quite delicious with lots of varieties, particularly to meet the taste of tourists from South. The food provided at the hotel was as memorable as the beautiful places of Kashmir.  I am thankful to each member of the hotel, for the  hospitality shown by the staff of the desk, house keeping Mr Nadeem and the restaurant, Mr Vasim, to name a few. I Wish the Hotel Management all the very best and I also wish they establish their branches at various places of J & K for the need of Vegetarian tourists.

B V Hari Krishna Nanda

title: Pure Veg Hotel, Best Hospitality, Wonderful Hotel
text:
I visited Batra Hotel during my Kashmir family visit and stayed there during the entire stay and even cancelled my Houseboat stay. The hotel staff was very courteous and made me feel like home.
The food was good, rooms were clean, staff was polite and even took care of me when i fell sick.

The hotel GM is very generous and was willing to go an extra mile to make sure I felt comfortable and was taken care of. The price is a bit on the higher side but worth every penny.

A must stay place for anyone traveling with family atleast. The hotel is close to market and places are easily accessible.

I thank everyone at Batra Hotel to make my not-so-great kashmir trip yet memorable.

title: 3 Night stay experience in Batra hotel
text: Batra hotel provides the finest service in Srinagar. I stayed with my family for 3 nights, the comfort of the family suite was remarkable. They have provided the well furnished, spacious, and well equipped room for a family of 4. The washroom was well maintained and in hygienic condition. Additionally, the staff was very supportive; especially Mr. Ashish ( manager of the hotel) is the very polite and friendly person. The best part of the hotel is the near to the main market, everything is available on walking distance itself. Not to forget the in-house restaurant of the Batra hotel, this is the only hotel in the Srinagar which served only vegetarian food. So if you are looking for a purely vegitarian hotel in Srinagar. The Batra hotel is the best. The served food was also very delicious, they provide the authentic veg kashmiri food. The restraunt staff was very good, especially Wasim bhai was very sweet. One must try out batra hotel; if they are planning to visit Srinagar.

title: Business trip
text:
So my employer selected this hotel for BoD meeting and we were tasked to make it happen. 
Hotel staff were friendly in nature from GM to bell boys. Checkin was a breeze, Ms. Nida and Mr. Peerzada at frontdesk were never short of anything we asked for. Since our most of the time was spent in lobby, bell boys specially Tawseef kept on assisting us with our tasks.
The Door man relentlessly kept opening door for us as I along with my colleagues moved in/out several times in a day, always with a smile and no complaints for 4 days of our stay. 
Food was equally good, with VFM buffet spread. Mr. Vishnu at tea/golgappa counter was fascinating. During breakfast, Chef at Live kitchen served delicious butter masala dosa and best coconut chatni. 
On occasions GM interacted personally to learn about any shortcomings, which were none for our stay. Last but not the least FnB Team Ishfaq Bhat, Shahid, Sajad,Aabid, Najeeb,Majid,Aijaz all of them were fabulous. 
Will highly recommend this hotel !

title: No way near 4*
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights.  We had 2 rooms.  The problems started as soon as we checked in.  The room allotted to us was filled with cigarette smoke and the toilets were stinking.  We immediately complained to the hotel staff.  Surprisingly, they just brushed aside our comment.  We left in a while and returned at night.  To our shock, the room still smelt the same and the toilet was in the same condition as we left.  We had to make noise, which we did.  The staff offered us another room with a big but........ The room cannot be locked from outside and we had to leave the door ajar whenever we had to go out. The staff informed us that the locksmith would arrive only the next day morning at 10 and the lock would be fixed. We were very happy that we could at least lock it from inside.

 Do you expect this from a 4 star hotel.  The Hotel charged me a bomb and they have no regrets that they put us through this.  The manager never bothered to visit us and offer his apologies.  The Wifi is so weak that if your rooms are inside, you will get no wifi.  Overall, we felt cheated by this star rating and the service offered by the staff.  We surely do not appreciate the hotel charging us so much for such a poor quality service.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Kashmir Visit via Cox N Kings June 2015
text:
We have just finished visiting Kashmir and stayed here for a total of two nights . We had two rooms. At the first place there were no toiletries available though provided to us later with the excuse that the rooms have been just vacated. There are absolutley no charging points in the rooms which is must nowdays given the fact that we carry multiple electrical equipments. The rooms from 110 to 127 onwaards are located at the back side and every night there is huge noise from outside of the kitchen staff . Secondly there was a peculair odour in the rooms , I feel mainly because of the kitchen being cleaned every night and the food being disposed off . The first night there was no electricity for around 4 hours . In the washroom of our room the commode was loose and the even the washbasin was loose and water used to leak outside . The curtains were too heavy to move them aside . 
The good part was that the staff was very helpful and attentive . Though I personally felt that the Manager was a bit too curt at times . The food was also good and well served , however the tables were always dirty as the hotel used table cloths and they are not changed frequently. 
However , the staff are very nice and helped me and my family. 
In all I feel there is a lot of improvement required to meet the standards of a basic hotels
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Great Staff & service.. decent hotel
text:
While traveling in Kashmir, we (group of 40 people) stayed at Jamal Resorts for 2 nights & thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The staff is very warm & courteous & all our needs & requests were fulfilled.
They lunch & dinner were reasonably good. However, the breakfast was very average.
Most of the rooms are compact. However, the heating system in the rooms is superb.

Since we were traveling in a big group, we had requested for a gala dinner & dj on the second night (at extra cost) & we had a great time.

We had a very good experience overall & would definitely stay here again.

title: NOT GOOD. HUGE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN WHAT YOU SEE AND WHAT YOU GET !
text: Not worth the money you pay. No basics available ( Soap, shampoo or shaving kits available) Rooms are badly designed. They have only one room as they show on internet for Super deluxe, if that is full, you will only get normal room as par of super deluxe. Do not take the buffet at all. Its rubbish. Some staff are really good nature and well behaved while few are arrogant even with families. Heating is OK.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Pankaj:

Thank you for sparing your valuable time and posting your review of Jamal Resorts, Srinagar on Trip Advisor from your stay with us!

We are disappointed to note that you were dissatisfied with your stay with us. Allow us to clarify the shortcomings. Our Check-in Time is 12 Noon. Your arrival at the hotel was at 830am. Early check-ins are not allowed unless notified in advance since we need to prepare the rooms for the guests. Since the hotel was running full, rooms were not available and your check-in got delayed as we didn't have prior information of your early-check-in. You were provided a temporary room which was not ready since you insisted on checking-in and starting your Tour. This room didn't have the usual Toiletries and since it was not ready for Check-in. You were shifted to your original Super Deluxe Room booking once you came back from your Day Tour of Srinagar the same evening. The usual amenities were present in the Super Deluxe Room including Toiletries. 

We have 8 Super Deluxe Rooms at the resort which are identical and exactly as per the images provided on our website and other Online Travel Portals. Im glad you have appreciated our Room Heating.

We would appreciate further comments & feedback on where we can further raise the bar, if you could email me at info@jamalresorts.com. Your feedback is valuable to us and helps us in our endeavor of constant improvement. I once again thank you for it.

Looking forward to welcoming you at Jamal Resorts, Srinagar for your next visit!

Warm regards,
AN MIR, Guest Relations
Jamal Resorts
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: A must stay !!!
text:
A 7 nights stay in the mid of December, and we are still amused with the essence of our stay at Jamal Resort. Excellent location, heart throbbing habitat and cozy rooms, the restaurant at the resort serves the best food we came across during our stay, quality of products at JCI Complex is marvelous and are ample in variety in comparison to other stores at the city (actually we minimized our shopping at JCI as we were already over baggage, feeling numbed), and the welcoming and friendly staff there are milestones in the field hospitality and tourism. 

Staff across whole JCI Complex and Resort provide their best possible support and suggestion as and when required, always ready to help and they seriously did, excellent room service, speedy service at restaurant and their dedication, sincerity and fun loving nature makes the atmosphere very delightful. 

Cab service provided by the resort, as we were traveling on the daily basis to the various locations in the city and nearby, was also extremely good and the drivers & the guides were polite and humble. 

We are planning our next trip, a much sooner, back to the "paradise on earth" and the stay would be, undoubtedly, JAMAL RESORT.

- Hitesh Khandelwal

title: A Warm and Welcoming Experience in the Heart of Srinagar :)
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights during our Kashmir trip in December 2024, and this was the most comfortable stay during the entire trip. The rooms are basic but clean, with an amazing view of Dal Lake, especially at night. Their central heating system is AMAZING and very much needed in Srinagar as it gets really cold at night. You feel cozy once inside the room/hotel.

I would like to thank Mr. Imtiyaz (Front Desk Executive) for his amazing hospitality and assistance during our trip! He is reliable, knowledgeable, gave good suggestions, and helped us with the bookings. Truly appreciate his guidance and support during our stay in Srinagar. Please connect with Mr. Imtiyaz if you need any assistance with your Kashmir trip.

Next comes the amazing kitchen staff. Everyone at the restaurant was warm, courteous, and welcoming. We were greeted and catered to by Mr. Irshad Mir along with his colleagues Imtiyaz Sheikh, Arif, Zahid, and Zakir.

All in all, we had a good and comfortable stay, and we will definitely stay again!

Cheers,
Pragya Girdhar

title: Excellent simply go to Kashmir and stay at Batra hotels
text:
The New year party was fabulous, Stayed 2 nights for the New Year's Eve at the Batra Hotels & Residences -Srinagar. Thoroughly enjoyed the hospitality and New Year Gala night. It was a memorable stay with lavish spread of pure vegetarian food, mock tails, bonfire, lavish brunch on 1st Jan.
The management of the hotel had arranged a very good party with beautiful decorations, good food, fine staff, unique performers of Kashmiri folk dance and a happy dance orchestra. Special thanks to the GM. Mr. Jaydeep Bhat for giving us such good memories from Kashmir. 
The hospitality was great right from the check-in till we checked out appreciate their concerns for the guests, Would definitely recommend the Hotel and particularly Mr. Bhat’s personal touch !

title: Paradise of srinagar
text:
We were on a honeymoon trip to J&K and with utmost fortune checked in jamal resorts, Srinagar.
If Jammu & Kashmir is said to be the paradise of India, trust me Jamal resort is the paradise of srinagar.
Anyone should learn how every hotel should be and how to treat their customers.

Unfortunately we got stuck in J&K floods as we checked in on 5th of September nad coul;d not make it to the airport due to flood devastation.
It was the people in jamal who made us not to realise that we are fllod victims rather they ensured we enjoyed our stay in those tuff times also.
If it was not jamal resort i dont think we would have made it alive back home.
Everybody right from the MD of the hotel their family members, the manager of the resort Mr.Bilal and everystaff of the hotel were extremely helpful, kind , courteous and passionate about customers and customer service.
I am working in a senoir position in a service industry and i have a very high standards of service expectations and beleive me, jamal has far exceeded the expectations.
About the quality of the hotel, its neat claen and tidy, all the time and the facilities are amazing.

In short its  home away from home, u ask and u will get it be it any thing and the food at the hotel is amazing.

for me next time a plan to J&K, it would obviously be jamal resorts with out any second thoughts.

title: Humbled by their service!
text:
We stayed at the Jamal Resort for almost 2 weeks and absolutely loved it. This hotel is a perfect place to relax and not far enough from the Main Street of traffic so you have a peaceful atmosphere. The staff at the reception was very welcoming (specially the manager Mr. Bilal) and very helpful. Rooms are spacious, whole hotel is impeccably clean, and the staff are lovely and willing to help with any queries you may have. 

A great place with the most pleasing staff and owners I have ever seen. Great food, Great value for money. They did everything possible to make our stay as comfortable as possible. 

At the time of floods all the staff and owner of the hotel helped us a lot and provided home like feeling at hotel.

For the price we paid, we felt it had totally exceeded our expectations. Will definitely stay there again when we visit Srinagar next.

Once again ,me and my wife would like to thank Mr.Bilal and your staff for making our stay so enjoyable during our visit to Srinagar.

Highly recommend this hotel!!

title: Big Name, Bakwas Service
text:
During our stay in Kashmir for 10 days, we stayed for 3 nights in Jamal Resorts. Though its building gives a feeling of luxury, it is very ordinary inside. My booking was done through Make My Trip in a luxury package. But I was given a room balcony of which was packed by a 6ft wall, so you can't have any look outside the room. The toilet was not even cleaned before allotment of room. On my strong objection they changed my room. Later I found that the Bed Sunmica was torned in the side which was dengerous for my kid. I complained but nobody took care and pasted the same.
In restaurant, buffet food arrangement was very poor. Thry dont serve variety of food in buffet. Very limited food option. With maximum one desert. They use very ordinary  cutlery in restaurant and for eating desert they will provide a 25 paise white plastic spoon which you generally see in a roadside snacks shop. Servicing in restaurant was so poor that you have to help yourself for all service including water and water jug, as waiter are busy in gossiping and watching TV.
Overall, it was total wastage of money against provided infrastructure and service if you are staying in Jamal Resorts, Srinagar.

placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Pathetic Food and Services
text: Apart from the location, nothing was good about the hotel. The resort is located near Nishat Bagh and that's the only good thing about it. We stayed in the hotel for 2 days - breakfast and dinner were included with the stay. Food quality was pathetic; be it for breakfast or for dinner. Rooms were comfortable but gloomy with very dim lights. Room service was also not good and waiters were quite rude - we asked for a cup of tea around 7.30 in the evening as I was not feeling well and the waiter replied "sir abhi dinner time hai; chai aapko 10 baje milegi (sir, its dinner time, you well get tea at 10)". It was raining the second day and we asked for an umbrella from the manager; a hotel staff person came up with a broken umbrella - this is not a service that you expect from a hotel like Jamal Resort. Overall not a good experience with the hotel.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Good location, but nothing else
text:
The best thing I can say about Jamal is that it is situated at walking distance (little more than a kilometre)  Dal Lake and Nishat Bagh. That's it. The staff is affable and helpful and the service is okay, but for their prices I would expect much better. Specifically, the rooms are clean but gloomy. It says something when a lazy person like me didn't want to spend a minute extra in the room. The furnishings are dark, the curtains were brown, there was wood (well, sunmica) EVERYWHERE including a wooden ceiling. Ugh. Can anyone say "claustrophobia"? The food was quite crap too. Sadly enough, there are no restaurants close by so we ended up eating at the hotel out of necessity. If we hadn't paid the entire amount well in advance, we would have found someplace better. 
In such a well-touristed place, there are tons of other options.  I'd say pick something else.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: choose the right
text:
On our way back from LEH, we wanted to stop over at SRINAGAR and check out a few things. Most of the others we found were either too expensive or not up to our liking. Found this place online, took a chance and it turned out to be very good. Except the view of the surroundings from the room we have nothing to complain. 
40 mins to Airport, very well maintained service apt type of rooms,  free wi-fi, free BF and excellent service from staff. Location is pretty close to MUGHAL GARDENS and we did cover NISHAT GARDEN,CHESMA SHI,PARI MAHAL,DAL LAKE etc. All travel arrangements were taken care of by the hotel General manager Mr Feroz,. Food is served in the living room  on request  and was good as well. The best hotel in terms of service & food, peaceful location, wonderful service, the service was more like man to man. and we had a great stay with wonderful hospitality the hotel offered. Excellent staff specially the G.Manager and the Manager Mr Latif managers,They helped me a lot also aranged me a sim card,that makes me feel home away from home.The owner has chosed skilled persons for his hotel they are really well taking care of the hotel.
Overall we had a very good  experience. Kids liked this place as well .It is highly recommended.
ownerResponse/text:

title: Best in the category
text: From Anil Arora. Firstly, Thanks to the manager Mr. Bilal - Courteous, friendly, approachable and resolves all your problems with a smile !!! Bilal ji, thank you and keep it up !!! and the upgrade to super deluxe room was even better. I think you are holding the fort for Jamal resorts. About the hotel, it is situated in a quite place which is pollution free and about 5 kms from dal lake with excellent mountain view. Folks let me tell you, staying in hotels near Dal Lake has it's cons like traffic, pollution..yes, there is pollution in Srinagar too :-( another important point to note is that most of the hotels near Dal Lake are decades old and not every place is livable. I would recommend Jamal resorts to every peace loving person. Can't expect any hotel better than Jamal Resorts in this category!! though Non Vegetarians may not be happy with the options here..don't try and compare it with 5 stars and hotels in big cities

title: its just a regular hotel
text: very bad location (major drawback if u r traveling on ur own or if u wanna spend evening at main dal lake area). far off from main dal lake area and no taxi or auto wants to go there to drop u until and unless you pay them for both sides fare. rooms r fine and r equipped with an LCD and tata sky service. receptions area is fine as well. clean bed sheets and comfortable pillows but its hard to sleep after 5 am as very loud namaaz sound comes from a very loud speaker installed somewhere very near to room . pathetic is a very small word for their buffet breakfast and service. unhygienic crockery and cutlery. the restaurant's washrooms are disgusting. no recreational activities apart from a broken tt table, broken rackets and 2-3 children swings. make my trip gave me this hotel after charging me a bomb. title: Cheats on Net
text:
Cheats on Net
The morphed Picture of Jamal on the website is a way to allure tourist to pay (astronomical rates) and stay in the property. Go with NO expectation. Stayed for 3 nights this June 2014 with family and had a terrible experience. Like ‘Dharmasala’ doors will be knocked at 7 am even as tea/ coffee makers are provided in the rooms. The plug points do not work and for  hot water you have to inform reception every time and then through some funny system it is supplied. At times that also did not work while we were there. Food is okiesh. Trip Advisor should be more careful and check the pictures that are being provided for posting. This picture of Jamal is of the Jamal Industries and not of the Resort.

title: Kashmir Trip
text:
We had an absolutely wonderful experience during our stay!

	•	Majid, your amazing service and the extra packed breakfasts for our trip made our mornings so convenient.

Although we didn’t meet the chef personally, the food under Chef Khan’s supervision was delicious and well-prepared.

Special thanks also to Sajjad, Majed, Irshad, and Iqbal for their outstanding support throughout our stay. Your efforts made our visit memorable, and we truly appreciate the hospitality.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a homely yet luxurious experience!

title: "Our second home in the Kashmir Valley."
text:
"Welcome Hotel" the name of the hotel is is true in every sense of it.Kashmir is a tourist destination to be explored in every season ,we have been visiting Kashmir at least once every year and Welcome Hotel is like a second home in the Valley. The hotel will give you a warm feeling as you enter with the all wooden interiors of the huge reception area. The views from the hotel are amazing of the Dal and the mountains around.Special mention for the food ,the restaurant serves the best veg and non veg food I think available in Srinagar do not miss eating most of your meals at the hotel.

Note: Important to mention that without good service at the hotel you cannot enjoy any holiday. The  reception staff of the hotel special mention Mr Innayat ,Mr Imtiaz (he has all the knowledge a tourist needs) and Mr Masroor (the ever smiling person & warm person, we have a developed a special bond with him) also the housekeeping and other services staff are all  polite and helpful.

A big thanks to the Hotel Management to make all our holidays special.

title: A city type compact hotel in a far away location
text:
We stayed in this property from 26 Feb. 2014 to 1st march (3Nights)
And again for 1 Night on 2nd march to 3rd march.
It is Located about 10-11 kms from the city. When your choose a hotel at a distance and that too a resort you expect a big property with some facilities not just rooms. But it is just a city type hotel property. It definitely is not a Resort. It is situated in the complex of Jamal Carpet Ind.     I.E JCI ( a joint venture of JCI ) WHICH IS A  two storied show room , has a parking area and a lawn in front of the showroom. Pictures are misleading. Whatever you see in picture taken from the gate of the complex is the show room and parking of Jamal Carpet Ind. The hotel is on the left side of showroom not at all visible in the picture. The same I have marked in the pictures.
 It has two rows of rooms along the depth of whole plot with a 4’ to 5’ wide corridor in between.  All the rooms on ground floor are Double DX Rooms (26). They are small sized approx 12’* 10’ with a Bath area of approx 6’*5’.  There are 4 super Dx rooms on 1st floor and 4 on 2nd floor which are bigger and better.  In all the hotel looks like an annexes in a big bungalow.
In one row of rooms i.e. 13 room –the window faces the parking area of showroom.  You can never put the curtain aside. Windows in the other row of rooms face a blank boundary wall about 3 to 4 feet away.  In a way all the rooms are closed boxes. Electric blankets and room heater were provided. Central heating is also available but is put on only from 7:30 p.m to 11:30 pm. 
No room has a view or sunshine at any time of day.
Staff: Reception executives Mr. Latif, Mr. Billal are nice, helpful. Other staff members are also helpful.

 Restaurant is at the far end of rows of rooms. It is not centrally heated. Only one gas heater in all with a sitting capacity of 50 to 60. So you feel chilly inside the restaurant as Srinagar is a very cold place for most part of the year.
Staff is good but deficient is service in etiquette.
Breakfast was included in our tariff. Whatever they serve has to be taken and choices are limited. They did provide me omlette on request. But on all four days request for Parantha was declined. Every day they said “it is not in menu to-day” Moreover everything becomes cold very soon. 
 We had to face a v sad experience for dinner. 
On the first night we found Buffet dinner was laid out, with limited veg options. Price Rs 450 per pax. As per the quality and ambience the price is at a higher side. Moreover we usually prefer ala cart dinner as we eat v less at dinner. That way one has more choice rather than a fixed menu.
I told them so.
 Answer was: “Sir even if you choose ala cart we can serve only from the items already prepared for Buffet. We will make a potion from the same and serve you. You can’t choose anything else from the menu”.
It was really a first time experience for me. Then the Restaurant’s executive himself said that for two of you as a concession we will be charging for one. 
I told them that for that we will have to share from one plate and just to pay less I don’t want to do that.
He further said that we can use two plates. 
After dinner we asked for the bill so that we sign it In order to avoid any misunderstanding at time of check out. They agreed but reluctantly.
2nd Night:  they said the bill will be sent to the reception only. I felt something was odd and insisted on seeing and signing the bill. After some arguments they told that now they will charge for two and not one as promised the 1st night. On my insistence and reminding them their own offer and commitment, they prepared the bill for Rs 450/- and got it signed.
3rd Night: as we picked up the plates and were just going to put something in the plate a man jumped towards us and told “AAP AISE NAHI LE SAKTE.  APKO DO KE CHARGES LAGENGE.” These were the actual words.
 We were speechless, didn’t know how to react. I didn’t know what to say as there were other guests around. Feeling cheated and helpless we put the plates back and rushed to our room without uttering a word.  We felt very humiliated.
After some time my wife ordered dinner from the room as we had not eaten anything during the daytime.
Next morning our checkout day we went for breakfast no one was making an eye contact with us. Every one realized they had made a big mistake with their guests. But No one said sorry for the last night not at least orally.
Summarizing: if you take out the showroom etc it is an ordinary city type hotel located at least 10 kms from main city area. All double Dx rooms are compact type. There is one almirah in the room but it has no partitions. It can be used only for hangers.  Very small dressing table (about 9’’* 40 “) in front of the mirror. But no drawer in it. You cannot unpack your luggage.  No room has a view. Bath room is also not big. No ambience. Though superior db Dx rooms are bigger and better.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Jamal's Kamal - The PadivalZ
text:
An excellent resort with an adjacent store filled with all the goodies you need to survive the cold winters of Kashmir and to carry back home some keepsakes and gifts. 

The service is top-notch and the staff is very courteous. 

Loved the Kashmiri cuisine delights! Considering the political and economical conditions, I found the price of the food quite justifiable. But, a few items could be tagged with a lower price. 

I would recommend this to anybody who wants to be away from the hustle-bustle of the City and still not be devoid of a City's offerings.

title: Memorable Stay
text: First visit to Srinagar ….We had a marvellous stay in Srinagar at Jamal Resorts. Beside this the resort is a beauty in itself be it a traditional wonderful interiors, very good service and some excellent dining too, must recommend the hotel's Restaurant for the traditional cuisine and some exquisite non veg dishes.  Hospitality and housekeeping personnel were very helpful and dedicated. Especially the cleanness of the rooms and hotel facilities impressed me. The reception people were nice and hospitable and helped us out in all possible way be it any fault during the stay or arranging vehicles for commuting.  My only qualm was that the restaurant closed a little too early each evening. Still, I strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Forgettable but not all that bad.
text:
While the rooms are good and spacious, the housekeeping staff certainly needs a crash course for the up-keeping. Linen especially towels were not very clean. Food was above average and the service was ok type as the staff was untrained and very aggressive. The only good thing about this hotel was that it was very close to the Mughal gardens. Restaurant again needs to be kept clean as you cannot sit inside and have your meal due to a foul smell. The hotel has the potential to be among the best provided it is well kept. 
There are better options available.......... so choose wisely.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Horrible!!!
text: This is one of the worst hotels i have stayed in!!! we took the promo inclusive of breakfast and dinner and it was a huge dissapointment! i was served spoilt coffee (the milk was bad)..the rooms was dirty and filty..the bathtub in the bathroom was outrageously dirty...the bedsheets was dirty..i found hair on the bed when i came in..there was no pillowcase..the room has an odour...terrible place..doesnt even deserve 1 star..horrible!!!
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India

title: Avoidable...
text: I had a booking in Jamal Resorts for 3 nights in first week of November. We checked in late in the evening. We had booked Super deluxe rooms which are on the second floor. First of all we noticed that the size of the steps was too big and it was tiring to climb them. The rooms were good, clean and spacious. I think they are newly built. The bathroom was also nice and big. So far so good. The first problem started when we went to there restaurant for dinner. The floor was very dirty and sticky and the place was stinking. We decided to sit outside due to foul smell. Next day we had to visit Sonamarg but to our surprise there was no hot water in the bathroom. After several complaints and waiting for 2 hours, we left without taking bath. Even the next morning there was no hot water an after repeated complaints we got moderately warm water after 2 hours. So we finally decided to check out after 2 nights only and move to another hotel for the 3rd night. The hotel I think has nice rooms but it is not professionally managed. The staff and the management has a very casual attitude, gives you a feeling you are staying in a guest house and not a resort.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Compact rooms but comfortable and clean overall
text: We stayed three nights in October 2013. Location is a bit far from Dal Gate area but there's plenty shopping areas around the Nishat area. Rooms are a bit compact; perfect for a couple but not sure how they would fit in an extra bed. Perhaps they have larger rooms for 3 beds but do check in advance. Plenty of electrical points (rare in hotels these days). Zero fuss hot water around the clock. The hotel is not too large and is actually a part of a carpet showroom complex owned by the same people. Free wi-fi in lobby and if you're lucky, in the rooms closer to the lobby. Lovely garden with flowers. No amenities like in-room coffee/tea. Large LCD with DTH. Staff was friendly and helpful. Central A/c.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Value for Money

title: Nice Child-friendly resort.
text: We were a group of NRIs from Montreal Canada booked at this resort in Srinagar. The resort is located in Srinagar near the Dal Lake and provides good quality rooms and a great ambience. Since we were travelling with as many as 7 children, we found the games and kids’ facilities at Jamal really useful and our kids were pre-occupied all the time. The resort itself is quite large and there is always something to do in case you are spending a day there. However we did find ourselves sightseeing for most of the days we were there. The rooms are new and well designed. We were staying in the Super-Deluxe Rooms which are at par with the hotels in Montreal. The bedding quality was very good, the flat panel TV has premium cable channels and that too in HD. Bathrooms were well done as well with a nice cute tub. They have a nice restaurant which has indoor as well as outdoor seating. We had ordered a barbecue for all 15 of us and had a great time in the evening time. The service is attentive and waiters are eager. We found that the restaurant would get very crowded at 9 pm and hence we used to go earlier at around 7:45 pm to avoid the rush. Food quality was good a bit spicy for our liking. Desserts were amazing especially the Indian ones. Recommended for Families with kids.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Amazing Experience
text:
My mother and her sister recently stayed at Welcome Hotel in Srinagar, and they had a wonderful experience. The hotel is beautifully situated with stunning views of the Dal Lake, which they absolutely loved.

They were particularly impressed by the warm and welcoming service, especially from the manager, Imtiyaz. He made sure their stay was comfortable and enjoyable, always going the extra mile to assist them with anything they needed. Imtiyaz's hospitality made them feel right at home, and they appreciated his helpful recommendations on what to see and do in Srinagar.

The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, with well-appointed rooms that offered everything they needed for a relaxing stay. They also enjoyed the delicious food served at the hotel's restaurant, which had a good mix of local and international dishes.

Overall, my mother and her sister had a fantastic time at Welcome Hotel. They left with fond memories and would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Srinagar, thanks to the exceptional service and the care they received from Imtiyaz and the rest of the staff.

The manager, Imtiyaz, was extremely helpful, assisting us with an early check-in and allowing us to store our luggage until our late evening flight. The food was excellent, and the breakfast offered a good variety of options. The restaurant staff were also very attentive.

A few aspects could have been improved. For instance, we had to request additional tea mugs to accommodate the number of people in our room, as the housekeeping staff only provided the standard two mugs, even though we had booked a family suite. Additionally, one of the bathrooms lacked hand soap, so we had to ask for it. However, the staff responded to our requests promptly.

Overall, we had a wonderful time.

title: A boutique resort in a carpet complex
text:
Jamal carpet industries is known to all. Not the resort. It is little far from downtown Srinagar. A few minutes by car from Shalimar bag. 
The compound is quite big with a playground and a two storied carpet showroom. 
The reception desk((01942464363) staffs are polite and helpful.
Manager Mr. Bilal Ahmed is a good looking handsome young man((09796516077).
Double delux rooms are in the ground floor  which we found to be little crammed up and ordinary. We shifted to super delux rooms on the first floor on the third day and that made all the difference. These rooms are large and classy with spacious toilets. Though the water heating system was little complicated, but we somehow managed. 
The food was a let down at Jamal. The breakfast and dinner spread was very limited and run of the mill type. There is no wi-fi in the room. You need to go to the lobby to access to the net.
