title: Not a resort by any standard, wastage of money
text:
You surely have heard about "a potent Indian herbal laxative. The so called resort is no different. We , a group of four stayed at this Godforsaken place on 21st June, 2012.

Why:
1. It is not worth Rs. 6,000/- per night. Very expensive, not worth it.
2. It is more than 9 kms from Dal Lake, located on a small road. You will waste money to commute.
3. The rooms are very small. Your kids won't enjoy either within or outside the rooms.
4. The TV is just 4 feet away from the bed.
5. Hospitality industry stresses a lot on courtesy. It is the most important part. But, at Jamal Resort this is alien concept. Warning: You might feel insulted or unwanted, because they know that you won't purchase anything from there shop which is within the compound.
6. The rooms don't have an AC or a Fridge, you will need it in summer months as the temperature is similar to Delhi.
7. Please don't be mis-led by the pictures or description on the web-site. You will not find it among trees or mountains. 3-acre property (as claimed) is incorrect.
8. They refused dinner even within the stipulated restaurant timings.
9. Your perception of a "Resort" will be hit hard here.

Before booking I called up the resort, the person named Feroz asked me not to book via the web-site, as it will be expensive & he gave me a lower rate which included breakfast. But we did not get breakfast & we didn't argue as we were getting late. So be careful, you will not get what you actually pay for.

On our arrival, the guard guided our (self-driven) vehicle to the front of the reception (to take our luggage out). Feroz conceitedly asked us to remove the car.

They refused dinner 20 minutes before closing time. After haggling, they sent cold food to the room.

Its not Kashmir, it is "Cash More" "as they consider Indian" travellers.

Arvind Sen
Former, Principal Correspondent (Travel & Tourism), Indian Express
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: POOR ACCOMODATION
text:
We, two sr,ctzn, booked this acco through Cox & Kings, by default as our choice was Grand Mumtaz ( now under renovation). We had to stay there on 20.03.13 and from 24.03.13 to 27.03.13. We specifically asked for twin sharing room with two seperate beds in a room. When we reached there find that the room appointed for us is a double bedroom. On insisting seperate two beds in the room they seperated the double bed in a 12'x10' room without having any wardrobe, luggage racks and any comfortable chairs/ centre table. We could not even open our suitcaes properly. Attached toilet is of 6'x5' size very cramped. We told them to provide a decent deluxe room which they agreed to provide during our return stay from 24.03.13 for three days. But this time also they could not provide the room  asked for (rm. no. 126) inspite of their earlier agreement. Instead they provided two seperate rooms on the rear side which are equally bad without any furnitures and with very old uncomfortable bed mattresses ( Rm. No. H4 & H5 and without any wardrobe/chair/table). It is found that this hotel do not have any arrangements for twin sharing rooms. All rooms are meant for couple staying in double bed.
Jamal resort is owned by owner of Jamal Carpet Industries (JCI) and the website picture shows their showroom which is in focus and not actual hotel which is, perhaps, developed as alternative bussiness in the same campus.
Hotel is located in a poor neighbourhood and 1.5 kms away from Dal Lake shore road having no good view in and around, but the front side entrance to property is kept clean with a small garden.
Services are okay. Behavior of staff are also satisfactory. Food is okay but no variety.
In short it can not be rated more than 2*.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

Bathroom hygiene need to be improved as a suggestion.

title: NO STANDARD
text:
Horrendous for the following reasons: 
1. Rooms - The layout of the room so is very weird, sheets were not clean, the sofa was also weird and peeling. Very odd bathroom as well, the showering area and toilet area is not split so the whole toilet gets wet when you try to shower. There’s a rainfall shower but the regular hand shower does not work so you’re expected to shower with a pail. The toilet bowl itself does not flush properly. The rooms and cleanliness was just not up to the mark and not worth the money at all, especially during peak season. 

2. Breakfast - The breakfast food is not nice and there’s very little options. The worst part is the dirty tables. The staff does not clean up after guests and you’re expected to sit and eat amongst crumbs and spillage. Even if you ask the staff to clean the table, they do a terrible job and there’s leftover food on all tables. 

3. Staff - They’re okay, could be friendly and more approachable, especially the restaurant staff. Room service takes quite a while to attend to your needs as well. 

I would not recommend this hotel unless you’re really desperate for somewhere to sleep at night. Although the location of the hotel is good, it does not provide the comfort of a hotel after a tiring day of siteseeing. We dreaded coming back to the hotel. I wish I had taken pictures but I really disliked this place to the point of not wanting to take any pictures of it.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest

I apologize for all the trouble that was caused to you. I have noted down all your observations for a suitable corrective action and discussed internally with the Managers concerned and implemented measures to ensure that our service standards continue to improve.

May I request you to treat this experience in isolation and give us another opportunity to serve you in near future.

We thank you for your patience and feedback.

Warm regards

Jaydeep Bhat
gm@batrahotelsandresidences.com

placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Great location and excellent customer delight
text:
Well words will be insufficient to explain to service and experience Batra Hotel creates for their customer. I visited this May for 4 nights with my family and rooms were out of my expectation for price they have charged. Room was so big and beautiful that made my family happy. Hotel is pure veg, if you are vegetarian you will like, also there are many pure veg restaurant and dhaba in front of the hotel which serve great food. So location wise it is good and Dal Lake is just less than 1 km. Staff is very good and polite and always ready to help. I would like to mention about Mr. Parvinder(Prince) and Munir for their great service and customer delight. Mr. Parvinder were quite helpful during the stay and even after the stay he helped me in dispatching my camera charger which I left at the hotel room.

My ratings
Location:4/5
Food: 3.5/5
Service: 5/5
Rooms: 5/5
Overall: 5/5

title: Paradise on Earth
text:
First of all, I would like to thank the whole team of Batra Hotel for their warm welcome and wishes. Everything was upto the mark and precise. We selected this place as it serves pure vegetarian food. Breakfast was the main attraction of our stay. We're tensed about the breakfast, but believe me, it was one of the best breakfast we ever had in a hotel. Moreover the property is well maintained.

Coincidentally, met Mr. Bhat - GM of the hotel in lobby. He upfront offered assistance with regards for an extra room whereas the property was sold out and gave us special discount also, and I found him very approachable. 
Will surely looking forward to stay in your hotel and will highly recommend this place.

title: Batra ---Dishonest Staff, Below Average Hotel
text:
This is one of the most hyped and overrated Hotels of Valley. The front desk staff is rotten to the core, dishonest and displays highest levels of sycophancy. 

I had the most horrible experience of being not alloted the rooms despite having confirmed booking on Goibibo. After asking them repeatedly,  they smile to their teeth and gave a vicious smile and said " SORRY SIR, OUR ENTIRE FLOOR HAS GONE SHORT CIRCUIT. As you are our old regular customers we ll fetch you rooms in other properties(which they didn't try a zilch)" . To my wildest surprise hotel was full and a couple who came after us was awarded with room stay..

I would like to warn other travelers that they must reconsider their decision to stay in this hotel equipped with Janus faced double standards staff and definitely below average rooms.

This comes from an old time customer of them

1 star is given just for the sake of alloting  stars...
ownerResponse/text:

Firstly I would like to apologize for the inconvenience that was caused especially from the maintenance point of view. I apologize for all the trouble that was caused to you. We have made a note of all your concerns and shall be strictly taking corrective measures to have them rectified.

Best Regards
General Manager

title: Pricey but very good option in front of Ghat 7
text:
Hotel is a old property(1986) but very very well maintained. 
I got a newly renovated upgraded business suite.
Mr Imtiyaz at reception was cordial. 
He Pointed out one of my error in booking (2 kids of different ages were erroneously booked as same age. I had to pay 1600/- per day extra for same) 
Overall room was big and I think freshly renovated and lake facing. 
Bathrooms were pristine clean with bathtub. Kids enjoyed.

Only thing if u get 104 room suite try to get the room in 2nd floor as the view of Dal is completely obstructed by the hotel name board.
Hotel is opposite to Ghat 7 so very easy to take Shikara ride from the Ghat. I took shikara ride at 7am with no tourists in Dal hence a serene experience.
Food taste was great both both ala- carte as well as breakfast spread. Breakfast buffet has above average options.
It was peak of tourism hence didn't get to interact with anyone from hotel but overall excellent stay. Will recommend it.
Pricey at almost 24k for a family of 4 with 2 adults and 2 kids aged 5&10.
I have mentioned price so that you all can compare on season and off season difference.

title: DONT GO THERE
text:
Its a terrible property, smelling of sewage, very rude and ignorant staff - the worst we have seen ever.
They served us burnt food, bed tea was served in the restaurant after 2.5 hours.
the heater stopped working at the night, and even after repeated request they dint helped us. ultimately we had to got to their store ourselves to buy an electric blanket.
even the location is very inconvenient very far from the market, so we had to travel a lot to get dinner.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Reviewer:

Thank you for sparing your time and posting your review of our hotel on Trip Advisor.

With reference to your review we are unable to find your stay details with us. Meanwhile would you please let us know your check in check out dates, room number & your booking details to enable us to investigate the matter as off-hand your review seems to be generalised, biased & influenced. You haven't indicated your room type, which restaurant at the property you ate in etc, no specific details. You have made sweeping remarks against our hotel in each and every category. As a responsible and genuine hotelier, we would like to investigate your stay to ascertain such sweeping resentment. Kindly provide us your stay details on info@jamalresorts.com and rest assured your stay will looked into and the issue brought to a logical conclusion. At present, as per our records we dont have any record of your stay with us.

A few clarifications for the reader. We serve Bed Tea in the room itself and not in the restaurant. In the higher category rooms, there is a Tea/Coffer Maker. We have the most modern German Made Centralised Heating System installed at the resort. Jamal Resorts is located between on the main Nishat-Shalimar Road. Adjoining are 3 markets of Nishat, Shalimar and Ishber. Within 1 km either way, there are at least 15 restaurants, 8 Hotels, and at least 35 Handicraft shops, 1 Large format Supermarket called Nova, and 2 Shikara ghats on the Dal Lake. 

We would appreciate more specific comments & feedback on where we can further raise the bar, if you could email me at info@jamalresorts.com

Your feedback is valuable to us and helps us in our endeavor of constant improvement. I once again thank you for it.

Warm regards,
AN MIR, Guest Relations
Jamal Resorts

title: Pleasant and memorable stay ..
text:
I stayed with my family in the later part of November 2012 at Jamal Resorts. Coming from Australia, frankly we were concerned about quality of service but it turned out to be extremely good experience for all of us. The cleanliness (room and any other part of hotel), service, food and usual courtesies extended from time to time was admirable. Everything went just perfect. Little details were taken care of as part of the daily routine that obviously helps in adding value. Let me be clear that when you don't have to run after minor items like heater not working, water not coming, etc. then stay becomes enjoyable and that is exactly I meant to say about Jamal Resorts. title: Beware... Service Non-Existent at this Hotel!
text: I had booked 2 nights at this hotel and ended up only staying 1 night and losing $80. The staff when  they were working were not helpful in booking any tours and could not even recommend someone I could try.The hotel is far outside the city so it is expensive to go anywhere. The biggest problem  we experienced was the hotel staff was not on duty from 12-7:30am. So, when our heater stopped working at night there was nobody we could contact. It was extremely cold here this time year. Breakfast was  included and it was 1 1/2 hours late so we had to wait while they scrambled to put something together and we had to start the day later than planned. Management was no-existent.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest:

Thank you for sparing your time and posting your review of our hotel on Trip Advisor from your stay with us in January 2013.

We are disappointed to note that your were not satisfied with your stay. Allow me to clarify the management's position on your stay.

You were indeed booked for 2 nights at our resort through an online travel company. You did not check-in on the first day as per your booking. You arrived on the second day of your stay and demanded a refund of your first night's stay. This is not possible as per the hotel's contract with the travel company. Your hotel voucher clearly states as under:

"failure of the guest to check-in will be treated as No-Show and will be chargeable with 100% retention"

Under these circumstances it is not possible to refund you a 1 night charge. This has been intimated to you during your stay and in our email exchanges as well. We hope this again clarifies our stand on the refund.

We trust that you will not hold this experience against the hotel and its services.

We look forward to your next visit to Srinagar. Kindly email me your next travel plan on info@jamalresorts.com and I will personally look into your booking. We would appreciate more specific comments & feedback on where we can further raise the bar, if you could email me at info@jamalresorts.com

Your feedback is valuable to us and helps us in our endeavor of constant improvement. I once again thank you for it.

Warm regards,
AN MIR, Guest Relations
Jamal Resorts

title: Cozy stay with impeccable service
text:
My husband and I were considering several options as we planned our trip. As it was difficult to gauge the quality of houseboats online, we decided to pick a hotel. My husband was the one who found this rare gem for us.

The property is large, set in one of Srinagar's best areas, and very well maintained. There's a children's play area and a well equipped restaurant. 

Our room was cozy, with wooden flooring and an intricately carved ceiling, a number of typical Kashmiri sofas and a large and comfortable bed. The bathroom was clean and well appointed too. 

We had a room heater and an electric blanket, which kept us more than warm in the near-zero December temperatures. There was plenty of steaming hot water for our showers.  

We loved the food at Jamal Resorts. Sipping their well made Kashmiri Kahwa, with saffron, cinnamon and crushed almonds, was the perfect way to stave off the cold. I really enjoyed the Wazia Chicken which I ordered from room service. Their breakfast and dinner buffets were quite lavish and were appreciated by all the guests. We especially enjoyed the sevaiya kheer dessert, which was superbly made. 

But more than anything, it was the service that made our stay so memorable. The entire F&B staff (Atiqullah, Altaf, Owais, etc) headed by Imran and the front office and housekeeping guys (Mohammed Yusuf, Majid, etc) headed by the manager Feroze and deputy manager Bilal, gave us a taste of true Kashmiri hospitality.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Perfect stay!
text:
My first trip to Kashmir. We were a bit reluctant at first but were convinced by our friends who had recently visited Kashmir. Jamal Resorts in Srinagar was not our first choice. We were staying at another hotel in Rajbagh area of Srinagar. But due to major traffic snarls in that area, we decided to move our hotel to a more tourist location with no city traffic problems. That is when I consulted trip advisor and chose Jamal Resorts. 

The hotel is just perfect and tastefully decorated. It is located in nishat area and near dal lake. All the sightseeing and touristy things are close by. The rooms are mostly on the ground floor. We stayed in the Super Deluxe room which I felt was better than the Suite, with amazing interiors and very spacious. The buffet spread in the restaurant is very good and the food with some local delicacies which were amazing. Being in Kashmir we didn't want to be stuck in a tight building of a hotel and Jamal Resorts gave us that open airy feeling with their open gardens and so much space. We spent most of our time in the gardens while we were at the hotel. In the evening we would walk to the nishat garden market and would hand near the dal lake.

All in all a perfect stay and highly recommended
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Great Experience. Would love to come back.
text: I visited Jamal in December 2011 on my honeymoon and stayed here for a week. First, I would like to thank the manager Feroz for his warm hospitality and arrangements for booking in other hotels too. Though some small issues occured like, low voltage resulting improper functioning of Room heaters, we were provided two heaters for comfortable stay. Food was good but they did not serve Tandoor chapatis as the occupancy at that time was low. Would definitely like to come again and stay in Jamal.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: ok
text:
We stayed at Jamal resorts for 2 nights during our Kashmir tour.The hotel was not much different from the nice photos posted on different websites.It is located away from Dal lake with a walkable distance of approx 15 minutes.The hotel in the vicinity looks similar from outside but we found the staff of this hotel was very nice which might be the separating point.
The hotel rooms are good but a bit small.In down stairs rooms bath tubs are not available.As requested to front desk they upgraded us to upper rooms on foc basis,that rooms are attached with bath tubs.It was very nice talking with reception.I really appropriate their behaviour.When I complained for bath tub.the food was of good quality and the staff was very helpful.I would specially like to mention about staff,they are so helpful I have  never seen.The meat quality was ok,but the overall preparations were very nice.
In summary we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would like to visit again during our next visit.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Dont ever go there!!
text: I had been to this place for 4 nights in Oct 2012.  I also went by some of the comments on Trip Advisor stating that it is good, etc., etc.,  However,  having travelled all over India and the world, I find that some of the folks that have rated this property as good - must have really stayed in some very bad places earlier!!! sorry - but this is my opinion.  First of all, the photographs may look good on web-sites, but the room is "COLD" and nothing special.  Except for the bed which has heated blankets, the entire room is 'unclean' / cold and not worth the ratings!!  In fact i stayed in a "super deluxe room' - the front of the room was a high tiled parapet - later on realised that the room was above the 'main kitchen' - lots of noises from down below!  The tea comes only by 7.30 AM and no one picks up the 'room service' or 'house keeping' nos. when called before 7.30 AM.  The hotel reception does not guide you - but rather keep mum and does not provide any advice on where to go and what to do, etc., etc., - which is rather expected when they know very well that all the folks that come to their resort are tourists will normally go to usual places such as Gulmarg / Pahalgam / Sonmarg.   The restaurant sounded exhorbitant from a rate perspective - even though the food served was 'satisfactory'.  Nothing exceptional!  The wi-fi works only inthe reception area and we have give our lap top / ipad / phone - to the receptionst to log-in.  This was ridiculous.  The place is also too far away from the main market and there is nothing around the place in case you need to go for a leisurly walk.  Overall, I was very dissapointed with this resort - and would advise to look for something near the main dal lake area for rooms that may cost similar to what these folks charge!!!!!!
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Reviewer:

Thank you for sparing your time and posting your review of our hotel on Trip Advisor.

We are glad to hear that you appreciated our Food quality and taste. We are saddened to hear that you didnt like our room decor and found it to be "Cold". Our Bed Tea timing is 730 am but if pre-ordered it can be served even earlier. Our Travel Desk is equipped to provide you with Tour Packages, Local Sightseeings, Adventure Treks, Golfing rounds etc. The timings of Travel Desk are 1000 am to 730 pm. You visited our Travel Desk past the working hours and hence were unable to find any useful information.

We trust that you will not hold this experience against us. We urge you to visit Jamal Resorts once again. I will personally look into your next stay. We would appreciate more specific comments & feedback on where we can further raise the bar, if you could email me at info@jamalresorts.com

Your feedback is valuable to us and helps us in our endeavor of constant improvement. I once again thank you for it.

Warm regards,
AN MIR, Guest Relations
Jamal Resorts
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Horrible and dissappointed
text:
I stayed in Jamal Resort from 29th October  to 1st November for three nights :

One of the biggest disadvantages  was the location which is around 9km from any local market .
Everything is a fraud - it is not even a 3 star but they charges are like 4 star - for a mineral water RS 75 - cabs are expensive and autos not avialable .The food is below average - when we ordered for dinner came to know that no food except buffet is available which was sad......, since there is no close place to go out one has no choice. 

This is purely our experience..
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest:

Thank you for sparing your time and posting your review of our hotel on Trip Advisor from your stay with us in October 2012.

We are disappointed to note that your were not satisfied with your stay. Allow me to clarify the management's position on your stay.

Jamal Resorts is located between on the main Nishat-Shalimar Road. Adjoining are 3 markets of Nishat, Shalimar and Ishber. Within 1 km either way, there are at least 15 restaurants, 8 Hotels, and at least 35 Handicraft shops, 1 Large format Supermarket called Nova, and 2 Shikara ghats on the Dal Lake. 

Our travel Desk provides cabs with the most competitive prices in the city. Autos in Srinagar need to be hailed on the road. Our staff always assists our valued guests to get one, if required. 

Your booking was on Modified American Plan which includes Buffet Breakfast and Buffet Dinner. You had asked our restaurant staff to offer you A-la-Carte from the menu instead of the Buffet. This  is not possible, as items ordered under the Menu are chargeable as per standard Hotel Policy.

We trust that you will not hold this experience against the hotel and its services. Kindly email me your next intended tour of Srinagar and I will personally get your itinerary and bookings done.

We would appreciate more specific comments & feedback on where we can further raise the bar, if you could email me at info@jamalresorts.com

Your feedback is valuable to us and helps us in our endeavor of constant improvement. I once again thank you for it.

Warm regards,
AN MIR, Guest Relations
Jamal Resorts

title: GOOD MEMORIES
text:
I stayed at Jamal from 28th Sep to 5 th Oct 2012.This was my first hotel of my trip second being Comrade Inn and Pahalgam...
Jamal is placed in a silent location...walking distance to Nishant garden.Room service was good...food is good.....hospitality is best.....i enjoyed my 7 days stay .....at evenings at walking distance we went to nishant ghat and enjoyed the silent dal lake....after dinner the garden in the resort is the best place for enjoying the natural beauty and the cool weather
I recomend to all persons who is looking for a silent and calm area to stay in this resort

title: A great stay
text:
We stayed at Jamal Resorts in Sept 2012. The rooms are spacious and the staff are very courteous and friendly. Food is excellent here particularly some of the traditional Kashmiri dishes.
The double deluxe rooms especially are good and comfortable. We had booked a car as well from the resort for use for all the 7 days of our stay and this proved to be a sensible decision. Rhe driver Naseem was friendly, polite and patient. He not only took us sightseeing all over Kashmir, recommended places for shopping without pushing it on us and made our stay memorable by taking us to an apple orchard where we picked our own apples. Thanks Jamal Resorts and Naseem for all the comfort.

title: Great 3* Hotel
text:
We have been roaming in Kashmir at different locations, and stayed at many hotels prior to this. Most of the hotels were 3* or above, but there were problems everywhere. Some had heating issues, some with breakfast and food, and some had issue with staff behaviour. This was out last stay and the best amongst all of the stays.

Room was good, not much decorated but decent enough. Heating was perfect as there was hot and cold ac which you can control yourself. Previously we stayed in centralised heating system which couldn't be controlled and sometimes becomes suffocating, or they provided blowers which was not sufficient. View from room was just okay.

Food was great. We had great buffet breakfast here only, with many options and good taste.

Staff behaviour was exceptionally well. Everyone including at front desk, at restaurant, room service and everyone else were polite, helpful and friendly.

Other than this, parking was big enough, location was also good as it was at walking distance from Dal Lake ghat 1, many of famous restaurants like Krishna Restaurant, Gulab, CCD were just in front of the hotel, and other were also at a walking distance.

Overall, we loved the stay.

title: Mixed reactions
text:
1)	This is a mediocre hotel, neither five star nor a budget one – strictly somewhere in between.
2)	The rooms are average in size – you have to be careful of selecting the rooms – make sure that you choose only the 01s and the 10s, as these are the only rooms which offer a view. The rest are facing neighbouring walls.
3)	Beds a okayish. 
4)	Poor bathroom concepts. The aqua area is a single room with zero partition for the bathing area. 
5)	Good working AC. Wifi. Lighting. Charging points.
6)	A strictly professional staff – working on instructions. No personal touch.
7)	A minimal breakfast. Poori, sabji, chhole, dosas, boiled eggs. No confectionary.

A little inconsiderate on hygiene and infrastructure. But at the same time, a decent option considering the location. So mixed reactions.

title: Below average room, nice location & avg service
text:
We stayed there as a family in 1st week of April 2021. We were allotted a room at 2nd floor. The room was pathetic.. Carpet was very very dirty.. And there was a  smell of cigarette... TV unit was in one corner..  Only thing was a there was a view to the room towards the main door..   Hot water is only available during particular timezones.. So when we reached there, there was no hot water available and we had to take bath in cold water only.. 

Food is OK.. But the breakfast buffet is also not good.. There is not much variety.. On the name of fruits, you will hardly see any fruit.. 

After couple of days, they shifted us to another room which was much better than previous room..  But that was last night of our stay there.. 

Good point is location is very close to dal lake.. Kind of walkable from there.. Food joints are just opposite to the hotel ..

Overall nice location, but bad rooms and lack of facilities..

title: Bad experience. Not recommended at all !!
text:
Don’t understand how this Hotel boasts of being a 4 Star Hotel, in fact the Hotel do not deserves even 2 stars based on the facilities, services and the amenities provided.
First of all tariff is too high and the available services and amenities are Null in comparison of that. Even the basic things like toilet paper roll, hand towels, dental kit and other toiletries are not available in the rooms. Rooms are not so spacious and comfortable; the hot kettle available is not properly clean, in wash room warm/hot water does not flows 24/7, beddings are seem older and not up to the mark overall cleanliness and hygiene was poor.
Further rooms are not sound insulated, you can clearly listen what person in your next room saying or talking. The buffet breakfast has very limited options to choose from.
From the very first view itself hotel looks like very basic and of no attractiveness.
I visited Hotel during 1st week of April 2021 and in these pandemic times no one is following the COVID protocols, staff is rarely seen wearing masks forget face shields or hand gloves. No focus on hand sanitization or maintenance of social distancing.
Had a bad experience here. Not recommended at all !!

title: Good Resort
text:
We stayed at Jamal Resorts  during a recent trip to Kashmir -- and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. We stayed in a two-bedroom . The rooms were spacious and well kept. 

What I enjoyed the most was the food. I have stayed at pahalgam but food was not so good , But at jamal Resorts food was excellent and delicious. cooks were very skilled too.  One evening  on request of the Manager we were served roast chicken and fried fish with potato wedges -- again most delectable.
The staff are very friendly and attend to your every request in the shortest possible time. I would in particular like to praise the staff here who are always so very eager to see that you had a good and enjoyable meal. That is a very good management. The spread itself is varied and caters to an Pan-Indian taste.
it is a very good hotel in srinagar.the rooms are bit small,But well cleaned .I enjoyed it very well.We will come back soon.

title: Average hotel close to popular Mughal gardens
text: It's an average hotel priced higher than its worth. Only advantage was that it was very close to Nishal and Shalimar gardens and also to the Dal lake. Otherwise it's bit far from the heart of the city and commuting could be a problem. It also has Jamal carpet shawl showroom next to it and they give a very good discount to people staying in the hotel. Buying stuff there might come out cheaper than elsewhere. When we went there occupancy was less, there were fewer items available on the menu in the restaurant. However, service was good and staff was friendly.

title: Average Resort
text: I've stayed here during my visit to Srinagar for 2 days. I was here for an official trip and hence booked this resort as i wanted to experience a different place to stay. The resort is located far from the city center ( places like Residency road, boulevard etc.), but close to Nishat bagh. It is on an in-road about 1 km from the nishat bagh. This looked like more of a home grown resort rather than a professionally run outfit. Rooms are decent but needs improvement (for e.g. the room key was broken and not changed for long). Though i liked the service of the resort, staff was courteous, humble and always eager to help. Every room is not equipped with wifi internet, so you need to check before check-in. Rooms close to the reception only has internet facility. Buffet bfast was limited (maybe because the occupancy was less), however for a guest at any time, would require min standards.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Beautiful Resot, Service!
text:
Jamal Resorts was our primary base while we were in this beautiful vale of Kashmir. It has always been our dream to go to Kashmir, our very own Switzerland. The hotel which was carefully chosen after reviewing all hotels in this category in Srinagar, just like we always do. The hotel is about 35 minutes from the Srinagar Airport. Once you cross the crowded areas of Rajbagh and MA Road and arrive near Gupkar Road and onwards to the beautiful drive alongside the Dal Lake, aptly called Boulevard, only then you see the beauty of this valley with the classic landscape of mountains, lush green trees and the beautiful lake. The drive along the lake is just fascinating and takes you to Nishat Gardens and that is where this hotel is located. 

The entry to the hotel is quite grand with a nice private drive-way along a garden leading up to the hotel wing. The reception is housed in a separate wing is quite large and airy and we were promptly attended to and just breezed through the whole check-in process. Before we knew it our luggage was transferred to our rooms and all very smooth. We had taken 2 Super Deluxe Rooms which were very Pan-Asian to Neo in its design. Nice large rooms, a separate sofa, tea-coffee maker, fridge, Flat Panel Tvs with premium channels, the works. The linen was as good as any 5 star hotel and very well maintained. The bathrooms are as good as any we have been to with a nice sized bath-tub. The accommodation definitely felt like we were in a higher category hotel. 

Since we were on a Breakfast included plan, we were offered the Buffet. Its not the biggest spread in the world but has adequate choices and of good quality. Our Lunch was mostly during our hectic sightseeing day trips so we never tried the Lunch at the hotel. We did have dinner during our entire stay and we ordered a-la carte. We tried all cuisines Chinese, Indian and Continental and we came away very impressed with the food and taste. Nice formal cutlery as well. The service is not the fastest but very reliable and courteous. Just love the slight Kashmiri accent in the English and the Hindi.

We opted out of our last day of sightseeing as it was getting too hectic and just spent the day at the hotel. Just relaxed at the hotel and enjoyed the beauty around the hotel. The hotel is located with Zabarwan mountains on one side and the Dal Lake on the other side. Our children tried the outdoor play area which has slides and see-saw type of rides, so you know how kids never leave form such places. While I tried my hand at Badminton and Table Tennis with my champion wife. Obviously I lost as she was ex-state champion. We walked to the Dal lake and took a short motor-boat ride. The evening was spent in the lawns which has a Garden Café serving beverages and snacks and watching the sun-set in the Lake. A nice end to a beautiful trip to Kashmir.

Overall Jamal Resorts is an ideal hotel, location for a Kashmir trip and tourists should base their travel to excursion sites like Gulmarg and Sonamarg from this centrally located hotel. The rooms, service and facilities are very good and we came back very impressed.
placeInfo/address: JCI Complex, Ishber Nishat, Srinagar 191123 India
placeInfo/locationString: Srinagar, Srinagar District, Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir

title: Jamal Resort, Srinagar
text: Stayed here for two nights 08th-11th July'12. Nice place. Good ambience. We had booked the double deluxe initially but once we got there and saw the room, upgraded to the super-deluxe.It was a bit over-priced but we're glad we did it. Nice food - buffet and room service. We especially loved the Chinese. Wi-fi available in the lobby. So that's a plus. A couple of things - no lifts so make sure you can take the stairs. Secondly, it is in Ishbar, Nishat - close to Nishat and Shalimar Gardens but pretty far away from most other things. I'd say it's a good choice only if you are going to do long day-trips. That way, the fact that the hotel is far away from the main CBD area will not matter. All in all, a relaxing place but not if you are on-the-go!!!!!

title: Not worth the buck!
text:
After reading reviews on Tripadvisor, we decided to stay here for 4 nights during our trip to Kashmir.. The entire experience was poor to say the least..

1. 	The hotel is far far away from the city
2. 	The rooms are well furnished, but lack the basic amenities like electric kettle.. So, there is no provision to make your own bed-tea, and when you order for bed-tea at 7:45 AM, the staff says "time for bed-tea is over"!!! The room and bathroom are full of flies.. Our room was near the housekeeping room, and we could hear the phone rining through the night..
3. 	The staff is discourteous.. They feel burdened to complete their basic tasks like room cleaning, leave alone helping out the guests..! We had to consistently complain at the reception to get our room cleaned..
4. 	The food is really bad.. Breakfast includes cold paranthas (that too burnt!), stale and tasteless fruits, bread + butter/jam, omlette, porridge (horrible!) and powdered milk tea (served cold).. The restaurant is full of flies.. Even if you order a-la-carte, the food is nowhere near tasty and is extremely expensive..
5. 	We booked a cab through them.. Not only did they earn a hefty margin on it, they also misled us in terms of cab timings and tariffs.. The whole experience left us feeling cheated.. 

All in all, this hotel is nowhere near a 3* also! When you are paying 4k+ per night, you expect friendly staff, full amenities and good food.. Will not recommend this place for anyone who wants a headache free vacation..
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sparing time and posting your review of our hotel on Trip Advisor from your stay with us in July 2012

I am glad to hear that you have liked our rooms and that they are well-furnished and to your liking. Just to re-confirm with you that Electric Kettles are only provided in the higher category rooms. 

Jamal Resorts is located in the main Tourist Area of Nishat, just 0.5 kms from the Dal Lake. Our distance to the Main City Business Centres like Amira Kadal, Lal Chowk is 8kms which are of non-tourist interest.

We appreciate your concerns of room cleaning but as you are aware that during your entire stay you never left your room keys with the Reception for cleaning and Housekeeping services. Your room could hence not be cleaned during the normal hours and had to be cleaned and serviced only in late evenings once you were back from sightseeing. This might have caused a bit of discomfort to you, but as pointed out it was entirely due to your reservation of leaving the keys behind and having the rooms cleaned during the day. 

Our buffet breakfast timings are 0730 hours to 1030 hours. This timing is communicated to all our guests on check-in and is mentioned on our In-room Dining Menu cards as well. Inspite of this your guests arrived late everyday for Buffet Breakfast at 1100 hours or later. This is well beyond our buffet breakfast timings. Due to this you may have found that the buffet is not well-stocked and fresh, as it was well past the closing time for buffet. We did however accommodate you and even provided you a-la carte breakfast free of cost on one occasion. 

Our Travel Desk at Jamal Resorts arranges daily sightseeings, golfing rounds, adventure treks etc services for all our in-house guests. However, we have no records of a cab being booked through us by you. 

Jamal Resorts believes in providing top quality service levels. However we do require co-operation from our guests in adherence to timings and procedures of the Resort to ensure the service levels are not compromised. 

We would appreciate more specific comments & feedback on where we can further raise the bar, if you could email me at info@jamalresorts.com

Your feedback is valuable to us and helps us in our endeavor of constant improvement. I once again thank you for it.

Warm regards,
AN MIR, Guest Relations
Jamal Resorts

title: Not worth the money - not even a proper 3* hotel
text:
The Good Part:
We were 3 couples booked by a travel agent for a vacation. We stayed 3 nights in jamal resort in may 2012 towards the end of our kashmir trip. Upon reaching the hotel, we were given 3 rooms. The rooms provided were modern and well furnished. However, they lacked some of the basic amenities which even a 2* hotel will have.
The bad part:
when the bell boy brought our luggage, he started telling us that there was no facility for runnin hot and cold water and the toilets are provide with individual Geysers which take an hour to heat the water. And he mentioned that he is informing this at the time of checkin so that we do not make a fuss of it in the morning complaining no hot water. However, the next morning around 5.30 AM a plumber knocks on the door and says that he needs to check some fault with the Geyser. does some thing and leaves in 30 mins, only to comeback at 7 am again and tries some more repairs. finally gives up and asks the guests to call for hot water and the same was provided in a bucket one after other.
Ordeal doesn't end here, the toilet commode's did not have a hand shower for washing and a bucket and mug was provided as in any cheap lodge
After this, the next morning, we reached the restaurant for the breakfast around 8 am. The cereals were served with Hot Powder milk. The only item in the hot menu had chola puri and the puris were fried atleast couple times since morning and kept for the guests to consume. On complaining, the manager appologised and promised they will not repeat the same thing next morning. In a capital city like srinagar, staff of the hotel said, they used powder milk and could not get fresh milk. This was the reason they could not serve cold milk with cereals. In the breakfast, only thing consumable was tea and bread jam.

we then went to the reception and asked for a checkout in light of all the substandard facilities provided and the manager clearly refused to refund anything. Though we could only get him to sign a complaint letter mentioning all the flaws since our arrival. Only after this, he started to appologise for whatever happened and changed our rooms. next day we were given better breakfast and a dinner in lieu of the earlier day breakfast. Me and my family's entire fun of holiday was spoiled because of the stay here.

Point of Caution: 
Stay here only if you are upto good rooms. nothing else will be good. hotel claims itself to be a 4* property, but i will not even rate it as basic 2*, combine this with staff attitude you are sure to regret the stay here. If anything on the breakfast menu needs replinishing and you ask the staff, they stare at you as if you are a beggar. On top of it, if you have to pay a hefty amount for such an experience, you can better avoid this. Srinagar is a big city and will surely give you better  options for staying than JAMAL RESORT
ownerResponse/text:

Dear Guest,

title: lovely Stay
text:
it took place only When  I cancelled the booking of Royal Khazar,after stayed one day.  . Right from the location, the ambiance, the artistic and tasteful decoration, the courtesy, everything was so appeasing. As per the facilities i ask for the games we were told presently they can provide carom,badminton other games are under process as the manager showed the places.
We were told that this place was converted into a hotel just a decade or two back.Had the Kashmir been peaceful , this would have been the most popular hotels in India

The interiors were very tastefully done up and it never felt like one is checking into a hotel. You feel that you are staying at the home of a royal Kashmiri family. 

There's a beautiful lawn  you can see the view  of  hills... where you can take strolls in the mornings and evenings.I went to Reception and ask them  to put some of chairs and tables in Garden it happen only in single minute I was really  enjoyable.

The staff is extremely polite and well mannered. The food and beverages too are great and served with silverware. They will ask you for the kind of food, go for the kashmiri meal, its worth having a go. It is rich in oil, Kashmiri Dum Aloo & Al Yakhni  is a delicacy.

As for as the hotel is very good to stay for two to three nights for couples and the  family mostly the childrens can easily pass their time  in a big space.

title: A Charming Stay Amidst the Beauty of Srinagar: Hotel Welcome
text:
My stay at Hotel Welcome in Srinagar was truly delightful. From the warm welcome at check-in to the fond farewell upon departure, every moment was marked by hospitality and attention to detail.

The rooms at Hotel Welcome were cozy and well-appointed, providing a comfortable retreat after a day of exploring the enchanting city of Srinagar. The staff, under the capable management of Imtiyaz and Syed Farooq, went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was memorable. Their friendly demeanor and willingness to assist with any request made me feel right at home.

The hotel's location was ideal, offering easy access to Srinagar's top attractions while still providing a peaceful oasis away from the hustle and bustle. The serene surroundings and picturesque views added to the overall charm of the hotel.

Overall, Hotel Welcome exceeded my expectations in every way. Imtiyaz and Syed Farooq's dedication to guest satisfaction was evident throughout my stay, making it a truly memorable experience. I would highly recommend Hotel Welcome to anyone visiting Srinagar, and I look forward to returning soon.

title: Pathetic experience!!
text:
My husband and myself recently visited Shringaar for a brief holiday and booked our stay at the Batra Hotel which is not far from the Dal Lake. Even though the communication services were down we still thought we can enjoy the nature in the laps of the majestic Himalayas far from the busy hussle bussle of life for a while. 

We needed a peaceful stay but fate had otherwise in store for us. Traveling from Mumbai one does feel the temperature difference instantly. Although it's warm during the day but since we had an early morning flight, we could feel the change. The hotel guys gave us an executive room on the 3rd floor which looked fair enough and spacious on first glance. But my first thoughts were on the heating facility available. There the Management informed that since number of customers were few heating element was off and they could oblige us by providing a simple heater!! 

I had to inform the Management this was not done for the money I was paying and we needed comfort. I was firm on this. Finally they shifted us to one of their so called best rooms on the 5th floor where the heating element of the AC was working. But the complimentary basket was empty, doorbell not working, night light out of order. Best was the washroom where you get hot water only in the morning and if you want to have a bath in the evening then God help because there's no hot water. To make it worse, there was a bad water leakage just above the head when in front of the basin!! So in that cold since washroom is not temperature controlled, as you brush or wash at the basin, you have cold droplets of water falling on your back constantly which is not only uncomfortable but highly irritating. 

The Management were called and informed about all this but nothing changed during our 3 day visit. Even difficult to believe but the Wall clock in the room was not working which got rectified after a day's stay! 

The buffet breakfast is just about bearable but highly unmanaged. You have to call and ask for basics like water. Most of the time buffet is laid just like that without any staff. So if you are in a hurry you had it! They are very slow in their service also. If you eat out that's better but if you want to order your lunch or dinner here then God save you!! You will be actually wasting your money because the food is pathetic. The chapattis are hard and brittle and the curry is watery with absolutely no taste. Even the rice used for pullao is very inferior quality. Moreover Most of the food items on the menu card are not available. Only Indian Menu available as per chef and there too you need to compromise.... If you ask for X you can only get Y, you ask for A then only B is available!! And for all this you pay a good amount of money. 

To top it all, after a full day outing or when you want to go down for breakfast and remain energetic for your full day ahead you come to know that the lift services have been stalled and is under repair which would take time. You would feel like hitting your head against the wall because you have to negotiate the steps through 5 floors either way!! 

For all these challenges at the hotel, the Management is absolutely cool and apathetic to the customer's discomfort. Since the hotel belongs to the Batra group of Delhi it's quite a shame as it's bringing down the name and reputation of the group. I think they should look into this matter and revamp the hotel for a better experience of travellers. All the Best!!
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest

I apologize for all the trouble that was caused to you. We have made a note of all your concerns and shall be strictly taking corrective measures to have them rectified.

We thank you for your patience and feedback and look forward to seeing you soon.

Best Regards
General Manager
Batra Hotel & Residences, Srinagar

title: Horrible experience.
text:
*Important Message:* 

Dear all Group Members, 
                   Myself Sanjeev Mohan DGM, Overseas Healthcare, North, I am here to share that I have made a booking with Hotel Batra in Srinagar almost 20 days back from 17th to 22nd June for 5 days. Yesterday I started  my journey at 3.00 PM from Jammu but because of Traffic Jam in Banihal Tunnel I struck up there and reached Srinagar 8.30 Morning. In between I have informed 5 times to the Hotel staff to keep my booking intact because I coming late due to Jam on Highway. But to my utter surprise Hotel staff given my room to some one else and asked me to wait till someone checkout. 

       Dear friends  this is not the happened first time, in December also without informing me they changed my room in between my stay and all my luggage was transferred to an inferior room by saying that Room lock is faulty. When I left in the Morning it was 100 % O.K. Even Centrally Heating System was not Working and after putting a Room Heater in my Room, light of the room was tripping after every 5 minutes. Then I decided not to make any booking in this Hotel but after 3 calls from Hotel reception with apology, I repeated the same mistake again.

      3 days back they make this group to provide good services but I am fail to understand that what type of services they are providing to their regular Corporate Customers. Sorry but I will not repeat this mistake.

   Regards. 🙏

title: It might be a nice place to stay in but be aware before booking!
text: This something about the hospitality of Batra Hotels. I had a trip planned for Srinagar, and this was a business meeting. However, due to the sad incident occurring at Pulwama just 3-4 days before my intended date of travel, I had to cancel my trip; I was still contemplating the trip but just a day back there were news of skirmish with the security forces. However, due to the confusion, I missed my timeline of cancellation, and now Batra Hotel is charging a full amount Rs 3615 for some reason of their own. The hotelier refuses to communicate over a conference call (as I had booked via goIbibo) and states that we will only go by our policy. Having said that I would request everyone to be wary before booking such hotels because they have only the commercial part to think about and will never realize what the customer is going through.
